title: Very disappointing
text:
A disappointing experience. On checking in we were given a lower level of room than booked, after some debate this was sorted but no city view as booked. 
Room had several things not working due to lack of maintenance, not particularly clean (TV remote very nasty), bed squeaked if you moved, had to turn off heating/air con as no adjustment possible so either very hot or very cold. Water said to be included but we were told to find the housekeeper to get it - why can't they put it in the room? 
No in-room tea or coffee facilities provided but chargeable at a high cost (I think we paid c$50 for tea bags and a kettle as you are charged for replenishment) . 
No hotel information in room (apparently because of Covid), all on TV display but navigating room service menus very difficult. Room service cost is ridiculously high ($14 delivery + service charge + tip)
The Oak Bar shown on in-room TV info apparently closed 6 years ago. The current Bar area is unusual in layout, very cold, not cosy, certainly not welcoming, all empty tables have reserved signs on to stop people using them. 
We had breakfast there at an extremely high cost ($11 for a piece of toast!) 
Wrong order brought, waiter had his thumb pretty much in the plate leaving a greasy thumb print, cutlery was very small, probably for desserts not main courses.   
In summary we did not feel welcome there, too many unfriendly staff whose starting point is one of questioning and distrust (it was hard to even get in the building, let alone have a drink at the bar).
A great pity but they could turn it around by seeing how the staff in the Savoy or Claridge's look after their guests.

title: Excellent Service!

title: Never felt so discriminated against.
text:
I am deeply disappointed with the service I received at the Plaza Hotel during a recent visit for my mum's 60th birthday dinner. We had booked the reservation over two months in advance and were eagerly anticipating this special occasion, having traveled all the way from Australia.

The food at the restaurant was delightful, but our experience took a turn for the worse when we attempted to use the restroom. A security doorman named Tizan, stationed at the door labeled "Hotel Guests Lobby," subjected us to an unwarranted interrogation. Despite explaining that we had just dined at the restaurant and were directed to the hotel's restroom by the manager, Tizan accused us of attempting to use the facilities without cause.

His behavior was not only unprofessional but also discriminatory and, frankly, racist. Tizan's actions completely marred what was meant to be a memorable celebration for my mum. I find it appalling that someone in a service-oriented role would treat guests in such a disrespectful manner.

This incident has left a lasting negative impression, and I will never consider returning to the Plaza Hotel. It's disheartening to note that similar experiences have been shared by others in previous reviews, suggesting a systemic issue that needs addressing.

Tizan, I hope you reflect on the impact of your actions and consider how they have soured the experience for guests who come from far and wide to enjoy what should be a special and memorable visit to the Plaza Hotel.

title: A Famed NYC Hotel.
text:
The Plaza hotel, one of the most celebrated addresses in NYC ......especially around Xmas. This Grande Dame of a property is surrounded by Central Park, Fifth Avenue, shopping, dining and NYC boisterous night-life. It's onsite shops are considered a micro Fifth Avenue and this was the primary reason I went to the Plaza. Just for fun I jockeyed up to reception to gauge what a one-of-a-kind suite would ring in at....the price brought tears to my eyes. Enjoying the delights of the Plaza is way above my financial grade.

So, if you wield a strong wallet and want to stay at an iconic hotel slam-bang in the heart of everything NYC...............then try the.................. Plaza New York...............A famed NYC hotel.

title: Resting on Past Laurels
text:
I booked a four night stay in an Edwardian suite to spend thanksgiving in the city.   The check in was very smooth and the property appears well kept with nice fragrance pumped right through the HVAC system. The entire place smelled nice as a result. 

I am a die hard fan of Fairmont hotels and have tried many of their properties over the years. Having stayed at their flagship hotel the Savoy in London and their competitor the Ritz, it pains me to say that the service here fell quite short of my expectations of a flagship property.  

The staff working there seem just “tired” and they do not seem to want to have any sort of genuine connection with the guests. They are just all about business there. This is very different from places like the ritz there they take the time to get to know you and engage in meaningful ways to make the stay a memorable one. 

Our suite includes some sort of a white glove butler service but I’ve not even see the butler once during my stay.  On the day after thanksgiving, somehow our room was not serviced all day. I even called in around 3 pm to request a house keeping service and it did not happen even then. I had to go to the front desk to request it to finally have the room cleaned.  

I think this hotel is great and has a lot of potential, but the staff training isn’t there yet. It’s also quite unique in the sense that it’s in a historic building in the sea of ultra modern high rises.   However, the hotel seems to only occupy the south wing and is quite small despite looking imposing from the outside. As a result most of the rooms don’t have much of a view to speak of.  If you are looking for rooms with views, you will have to pay quite a bit more for partial park views. 

All in all it was a rather uneventful and also unremarkable stay. I am Diamond with Accor and used four suite night upgrades for this stay, but they were not honored at check out. I had to call in and be out on hold for quite a while to get it sorted. The front desk person wasn’t even apologetic for this clerical error.  

I really want to like this hotel and would love more opportunities to experience its full glory. Perhaps the weekend was just too busy.  Although For the same price I’d recommend going with four season or mandarin oriental both of which have much better views and modern amenities.

title: disappointing, avoid at all cost!
text:
Booked the hotel for its iconic name and let's just say it didn't live up to its fame. To list a few: 

1. the staff in general were not approachable and friendly.  Most of them gave me the impression that unless I'm someone super famous/rich, it is not worth their 'warm/premium service'. 
2. service response were EXTREMELY slow. I asked to take away my inroom dining table, and no one came for 45min so I ended up rolling up to the hallway myself. Due to flight change, I called to see if I can extend my stay,  and no one called me back after 30min, so I had  to go to the lobby myself.  One night the inroom service told me that it would be 2 hours before the food would be delivered. 
3. they charge EVERYTHING, and I mean EVERYTHING. I was charged for a kettle and some 'tea set?' which consisted of 2 slices of dried out lemon, some milk and sugar which I didn't end up using at all. When we ask for kettle in other hotels, it is always complimentary. Similarly, I was charged $18 for them to deliver me the Uber Eats (as the inroom had 2 hours wait). So unless you are loaded and these charges are a drop in the bucket, be aware of these 'surprises'! 
4. After checkout, I was charged $14 from snack bar which I didn't use. When I questioned the bill over the phone, the front desk person told me that he would need to "verify" before reversing the charge. When I asked how, he said they would have photos. Then I asked how would a picture of an opened snack be a prove that it is something that I ate/didn't eat? To which the response was 'I am not trying to argue with you. Do you understand what I am saying?'. Mind blowing. 

I stayed in fair amount of high-end hotels around the world, and I can safely say this is the WORST stay ever. They probably won't care a non-significant customer like me anyway, but this will be an one-off experience and I will not be coming back ever again.

title: Mediocre comfort and service for top dollar price tag
text:
My husband and I decided to stay there on a Thanksgiving trip to New York. We figured it was worth the cost to have a truly memorable experience.
The good: the staff is extremely nice and personable, in a non-fake way. The bartender at the champagne bar was humorously grumpy about having to work on thanksgiving, which made us feel like old friends, for example. In-room dining staff (especially Freddy!) were funny and pleasant conversationalists while setting up breakfast. I was at the Philly Four Seasons in February, and the staff there was so snooty and icy, I felt like I didn’t belong and I should just leave them alone. But the staff here were great, without fail. Other guests were also quite pleasant.
The rooms are good sized with great closet space.
The mediocre:
The bathrooms are large and lovely, but the sink vanity had no space for putting toiletry bags. The counter had no extra room when I was putting on makeup or doing my hair, so I carted my toiletries back to the closet every time. There was no hook next to the sink for hanging toiletries. There was a vanity mirror, but it was not wall mounted so I had to hunch down to use it. So I didn’t use it. 
The bad:
The mattress. It was super hard with no cushioned topper. We could feel the tufting of the top of the mattress. I am 41, so not particularly old, and I woke up about every 2 hours with sore hips and had to roll over. It was one of the least comfortable hotel mattresses I have ever slept on, and my husband and I have a very firm mattress at home, so we’re used to a mattress that doesn’t give.
The pillows. Fluffy down pillows that collapse. Maybe I could have asked for different pillows, but you know what? There was no book in the room listing the sorts of amenities we could change or services that would be provided. I’m used to nice hotels listing the options you have for things like that (different pillow options being a common one), and I don’t want to guess or feel like a jerk for asking. They should tell me.
Room temperature. We could not get the room to be 68 degrees or lower for sleeping without having the A/C blasting cold air. The temp was set to 72 when we arrived, which is a little warm for us even during the day. For sleeping, it’s way too hot. If we set it to 68 on the mixed or heat setting, it stayed at 72 and got stuffy. We could turn it on to fan only, which helped prevent stuffiness but stayed at 72. But the only way to lower the temp was to turn on the A/C, which blows toward the bed, so when it turned on we’d get a shot of cold air blowing at us. Which woke us up. We even set the heat to 68 when we went out at noon, hoping it would be cool by the time we got back at night, but nope. Still 72. So if there was another way to get it to be cooler, we couldn’t figure it out. Yes, we could have called someone to see if we were missing something, but I prefer to have things just work correctly. Especially when you’re paying…$1800 a night. 
The sheets/bedding. Thin duvet that wasn’t very warm, somewhat scratchy sheets. They should have blankets or something in the closet. Again, I probably could have called housekeeping, but in my PJs at 3 am with AC blowing on me, I just want a blanked to use until the AC shuts off. 
Attention to detail by staff. Housekeeping was very nice, but several things were missing when we checked in. I had a bath on thanksgiving morning, and I didn’t realize that the jar above the tub was supposed to have bath oil/bath salts. I thought it was a decorative empty jar. So I didn’t have that. It was refilled the next time we had housekeeping, and then I realized. That same morning, after my bath, I showered to wash my hair. The conditioner and body wash bottles (wall mounted) in the shower were empty. We did make sure they were refilled, but still. 
We had room service breakfast twice. Neither time did all items make it up the first time. Not a huge deal, but again, when you’re paying like $18 for a pot of coffee, you don’t want to wait 35 minutes for your cream to come up. 
One small thing: no in-room coffee. Not even an nespresso or lavazza. In the morning, sometimes I want a single cup of coffee. I don’t want a whole pot, and I don’t want to wait an hour for room service to bring up a pot of coffee (and then anothe 35 minutes for the forgotten cream). I get that it’s a little gauche, but it’s pretty standard now. And again, $1800 a night…and there’s a huge bar with a sink in the room. Plenty of space to put the machine.
Cost/variety of food. Exorbitant cost, and while good, it wasn’t amazing. The tea is $155, and the Palm Court isn’t so lovely as to make it worthwhile. The Palm Court is also not great for dinner, but it’s the only restaurant on site. It was small plates/lunch-type food but for the price of a nice dinner entree. I happily spend lots of money on food when it’s good, but there wasn’t a ton of variety or anything notable about the offerings. It was like a fancy kid’s menu. 
The public spaces of the hotel. If you’re expecting expansive lobbies and places to sit and people watch or read a book, sorry. It’s very underwhelming. The lobby shown in movies isn’t for hotel guests, and there are three small old elevators. So you’re often waiting several minutes for elevators with a bunch of other people. The champagne court is a bar/restaurant in the morning for eating and drinking, not for guests to relax. It also encroaches into the lobby, so people are often tripping over each other in the little space left. There’s no grand stair, the stores are down this dark hallway and then dark stair, and they are all very small. The hotel was decorated for Christmas, but the trees and garlands were tacky white-flocked and boring. I expected more.

That’s the theme: I expected more. This is supposed to be an experience, and other than a lot of expensive marble, it was worse than most 4 star hotels I’ve stayed in.

title: Legendary service--a truly magical stay
text:
A magical trip! My sister and I were in town for just Saturday night, visiting my niece who lives in the city. We were there for a quick research trip for an upcoming book and went to several open houses on Fifth Avenue. (Book is called The Fifth Avenue Apartment). This was our first time staying at The Plaza--and it was so amazing, exceeded our expectations in every way possible.

I used my Platinum American Express card and when we checked in, we had a lovely upgrade to a junior suite with two queen beds. And when we walked in, our jaws dropped. The room was so beautiful and homey at the same time. It had two bathrooms, a spacious sitting area and bar and there was a little welcome box of macarons on the coffee table. The main bathroom was the nicest we've seen yet in any hotel, with a separate tub, toilet room, and huge standing shower with excellent water pressure. The details were so elegant--tile inlay in the sink, for example.

The beds were very comfortable as well. And the service here is just impeccable. We had the most delicious breakfast this morning in the Palm court. I had a chia pudding with almonds, pumpkin seeds, and fresh berries. It was light and flavorful and exactly what I was in the mood for. My sister had the American breakfast of eggs, bacon, homefries and toast. I had a slice of her bacon and it was so good. My niece had the special eggs benedict served on dungeness crab cakes. And that was insane. I am definitely getting that when I go back. 

We can't wait to go back. This will now be our go-to hotel because it was just so special and made us so happy. Next time we want to stay for two nights, so we can have even more fun.

title: Disappointing!
text:
This hotel was always on my bucket list so was really looking forward to the stay.
First the good bits…. 
Hotel is absolutely decorated and fitted out lovely with fantastic period architecture and in a great location!…
Now the bad bits… I expected 
The food and drink to be expensive but to be honest I found the pricing just ridiculous!
Example - Me and my partner had a basic meal and a few drinks and the bill was 400 dollars! and I swear we were both still hungry after the meal lol.
This coupled with  staff that were not interested in providing a good friendly service that would of made all the difference in the restaurant and for our stay generally in the Plaza, which would in my opinion mean we would of been paying in part for great friendly service that really would of made our stay special
I also found the staff at the front desk to be arrogant and generally disinterested and did not once during our stay ask how we were finding things and if everything was fine even when we checked out! Lol

The restaurant and concierge staff to be honest I found unless you are a multi - multi millionaire or billionaire with a care free attitude to signing for anything and everything didn’t seem interested in us at all.
We had afternoon tea in the restaurant that was disappointingly basic an all on one tray affair sweet and savoury and not served up as a special occasion for us as the paying customers.
We have had many high end afternoon teas that were a different class experience in the West End of London for half the money!
I don’t regret staying here as I always wanted to experience the Plaza but such a shame as could be so much better!!

title: Overpriced and disappointing
text:
As a special treat for our honeymoon, my husband and I paid for afternoon tea at the Plaza. However, what was meant to be a once in a lifetime experience was actually very disappointing. 

My husband contacted The Plaza beforehand to advise I’m vegetarian. This was also acknowledged at the reception desk. However, we received the one mixed afternoon tea stand with meat, fish and vegetarian sandwiches next to each other. My husband then had to ask which of the sandwiches were vegetarian as nobody talked us through the items on the afternoon tea stand. Additionally, when my husband highlighted that he’d requested a vegetarian afternoon tea, the colleague serving us briefly tried to apportion the blame onto us. However, he went away and brought out two more vegetarian sandwiches. 

With a couple of exceptions (the cucumber sandwich and the savoury scone, which were gorgeous), most of the food we ate was of average quality. We’ve paid far less for considerably better afternoon teas. 

The colleague who served us was polite, professional and attentive. However, his service felt a little disingenuous and more like a tick box exercise. 

The venue had noted that it was our honeymoon and brought us out a free chocolate cake (which was greatly appreciated), albeit an incredibly minor point-it stated happy anniversary on it. We didn’t care as we were grateful for the gesture but we felt it symbolised the complacent service experience we received. 

The venue itself is beautiful and the ambience lovely. 

All in all, we both felt that for the amount of money we paid, the whole experience was massively overpriced.

title: Nice, but not sure it's worth it
text:
Staying at The Plaza has always been on my bucket list, so I decided to book a 3 night stay on a recent impromptu trip to New York.

The location is fantastic- at the foot of Central Park, within easy walking distance of Times Square, the Rockerfeller Centre, Natural History Museum, Avenue of the Americas and so many other Manhattan hotspots. Taxi from JFK took about an hour but only 30 mins in the early hours to get back (usual Manhattan set fare applies). Theres several Subway stations nearby.

The staff were wonderful from arrival to departure- everyone was very friendly and courteous.

My room was very spacious, always clean and elegantly & elaborately decorated- I particularly liked the chandelier. The bed was comfortable, the lighting was good but a bit confusing to operate and there was a well stocked minibar. The ensuite was also spacious with good toiletries, plenty of towels and bathrobes. Only gripe was that the shower pressure was pretty poor and the slippers were one size and far too small for me. 

I had breakfast at the Palm Court one morning and the service was fabulous, the food was perfectly adequate but nothing to write home about (equally nothing to complain about but I would expect a bit more from such a renowned restaurant). I had a drink in the  Champagne Bar on a couple of occasions and whilst the drinks were good the service was rather slow. 

There's a good gym/ fitness centre and the shop on the mezzanine level is very good.

So, I did enjoy my stay and there is no doubting that The Plaza is a very nice hotel. However, at over $4000 for my 3 night stay I really don't think it was worth the price tag- in one sense, yes it was worth it to tick it off my list, but on the other hand I have stayed in better properties for far less. In many ways, I felt a little like I was throwing money away where it wasn't really worth it. That said, the ALL points/ status points bumped me up a level and I'm currently enjoying a free night at an Accor hotel in Aberdeen paid for by my stay at The Plaza!

text:

He was always checking in on us to see if we needed anything else, and made sure we had separate serving dishes of jam/cream etc. for the different diets and allergies. And I saw him paying just as much attention and providing excellent service to all the other people he was serving. He was fantastic!!

Check-in for our afternoon tea was also no problem. We arrived about five minutes early, and they took care of us from the start. My husband had his luggage because he had to go straight to the airport afterward, so one of the hostesses checked it for him. 

Really just a lovely experience, from start to finish!

title: “Unmet Expectations: A Diminished Experience at the Plaza Hotel, NYC”
text:
"Unmet Expectations: A Diminished Experience at the Plaza Hotel, NYC"

Our lofty hopes were met with profound disappointment, a stark departure from the renowned splendor one associates with the Grand Dame of New York City. The grandeur that once defined this establishment now appears to have faded into the past.

The deteriorated state of affairs became painfully apparent, as the ladies' restrooms lacked cleanliness and proper ventilation, a far cry from the anticipated luxury. The hotel itself seemed weary, lacking the luster it once exuded.

Our Sunday evening reservation for drinks magnified our discontent. Despite a sparse crowd, an excessive wait to be seated cast a shadow over the evening's plans. The evident understaffing was a glaring shortcoming that marred the experience. Our choice of a Sancerre wine bottle unraveled into a fiasco, with each person receiving a pre-poured glass only after multiple requests to the server.

The chocolate cake we ordered further highlighted the service's incompetence, necessitating three separate reminders and ultimately arriving after everyone had finished their drinks. The absence of an inviting atmosphere coupled with shocking service further dampened our experience. A comprehensive revitalization of the establishment is overdue, as the current state is undeniably dismal.

Even the doorman's assistance was rendered only upon our prompting, as they failed to offer aid with a wheelchair until specifically asked. Overall, the performance fell painfully short of expectations. Regrettably, we find no reason to consider a return in the future.

title: A Magical High Tea Experience at the Plaza Hotel's Palm Court!
text:
A group of girlfriends and I had the absolute pleasure of indulging in a delightful high tea experience at the renowned Palm Court within the iconic Plaza Hotel. From the moment we stepped inside, we were transported to a world of elegance and charm that exceeded all expectations.

Our server, Elvis, truly embodied the essence of exceptional hospitality. With a warm and welcoming demeanor, he effortlessly guided us through the menu, making thoughtful recommendations and ensuring that every detail of our experience was meticulously attended to. His attention to detail and genuine care for our enjoyment truly set the tone for an unforgettable afternoon.
What made this experience even more magical was witnessing the incredible kindness displayed by another server, Fariz. We had the privilege of observing Fariz go above and beyond to make a young girl's birthday celebration truly special. His dedication and heartfelt gestures towards the birthday girl and her beloved doll were heartwarming and showed a level of care that is truly rare to find and had us casual observers in tears. 

Overall, our visit to the Palm Court was an enchanting experience that left me utterly enchanted. The exceptional service provided by Elvis and the heartwarming kindness demonstrated by Fariz added an extra layer of magic to an already splendid affair. I wholeheartedly recommend the Palm Court at the Plaza Hotel to anyone seeking an unforgettable high tea experience, where elegance, exceptional service, and genuine moments of kindness converge to create memories that will be cherished for a lifetime.

She made my dream come true, and gave me an upgrade to this beautiful suite. The room looks like you walked into the
 1920s, combined with the great Gatsby and Fitzgerald himself along with his wife, Zelda, beautiful pictures and things of the era. I took some pictures that I up loaded on here but a video is up on my YouTube channel AngelPrettyEyes.plaza Fitzgerald suite.
 A few things… I WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK AGAIN!

Thank again Vanessa and the entire positive for making a wonderful stay in a dream come true.

title: Disappointed
text:
I was so disappointed. Expected luxury but maintenance was not what it should be and decor is not only dated but doesn’t take advantage of the incredibly generous space which is so rare in New York. Interior designer was sleeping on the job. No table, no sofa. Refrigerator doesn’t chill anything. A cabinet door didn’t close all the way. A faucet splattered everywhere. A tub faucet wouldn’t shut off so we had to call the Engineer. Toilet had to be double flushed. 

Pros: Service was cheery  and kind (although concierge never returned my call) and the bathroom is quite elegant. The location is amazing next to Central Park. They did deliver a fridge to the room. Fabulous closet space. 

We tried 2 rooms the first had a terrace which overlooks an interior courtyard with a fountain. The terrace was smaller than it looked in the picture and you need to step up to it from the room which is on the fifth floor and felt quite dark because the only windows were the doors to the terrace. The carpet was quite dirty. They moved us to a room on the 15th floor overlooking 57th St., which had windows at least but we could hear the TV from the Nextdoor room quite clearly. Security did ask the guest to turn it down. Overall, I’ve stayed in lots of five star hotels, and this one just doesn’t stand up to that level in terms of decor and maintenance. However, what is luxurious is the amount of space and the location. Might return if price were not so astronomical. At that price you expect more.

text: I stayed four nights in June. The (minor) CON'S first: No kettle for a late night or morning tea or coffee and no newspapers. The (many) PRO's: rooms are spacious and really well appointed. Excellent linen, super comfy beds and the staff are absolutely superb. Looking for luxury? This is where to find it. title: OK for one night, but a bit dated.
text:
A little disappointed to be honest. I would recommend one night here, just for its iconic status in NYC, but most of it is still closed, and the rooms a little grubby. We booked a suite. There were stains on the carpet, and chaise. Peanuts under the dresser area and marks on glasses.
The wardrobes/ paintwork is a bit grubby too. On the first night, we had to ask maintenance to fix the taps and WC flush and the lights - all of which broke or were broken on arrival. 
Afternoon tea was nice enough, but nothing to write home about. Just OK. 
We’ve been to dozens of places in London and NYC that are nicer. Maybe that was the issue - we are used to high standards for 5* hotels (Yeatman in Porto, Corinthia in London/ Malta, Clivedon in Windsor, etc.) so this just felt a bit dated. Perhaps if it gets back in full swing, or reopens the bars, or has a renovation of the old rooms, it might be better, but overall, the atmosphere was just a bit limp. 
Service was excellent and the staff are wonderful. It just didn’t meet expectations. We tend to return to hotels but won’t come back here.

title: Missing necklace, Plaza is zero help
text: I had an appointment at the Guerlain Spa and left a beloved gold necklace my mother gave me in the robe pocket. I called the hotel one hour after I left when I realized I had left it. The hotel assured me they would look for it. I find it incredibly hard to believe they lifted a finger to help me. I would expect more from a hotel like The Plaza. Truly disappointing.

title: Honeymoon stay
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon 
Was an amazing hotel. The staff couldn’t do enough to make our stay 100% We stayed in a suite and it was luxury at its best. Definitely returning !!!! The food and choice of wines was excellent. Can it thank the staff enough

title: Exceptional experience - Kabir was the ultimate host
text: Kabir looked after us from start to finish. Beautiful place, perfect location and incredible, tentative staff. We had an afternoon tea and the food and drink was worth every penny. Kabir made our visit one to remember - thank you

title: Another great stay at The Plaza
text: An excellent stay.  Beautiful property with incredible staff and service.  Great bar, great rooms.  Definitely should stay here if you can afford it.  Amazing to be so close to Central Park.  Walking distance to great restaurants and museums and incredible shopping.

title: Best service!
text: Babu was the best, took great care of my daughter and me while we stayed at the Plaza hotel on vacation. Even surprised us with sparkling lemonade and macarons! The hotel smells lovely and they have beautiful flowers in the lobby. My daughter and I played chess the first night in a quiet area with Frank Sinatra playing in the background. The area is excellent too with Central Park right across the street and plenty of high end shopping all around. A must see!

title: Just wonderful!
text:
We dropped in hoping for lunch and cocktail in the Champagne bar and were met with incredibly friendly staff who seated us right away. The food was wonderful, the cocktails were quirky and fabulous and a special mention to Naveed Ahktar who made the visit! Nothing was too much trouble for him, he was great with recommendations, went out of his way to make us feel special and we had a giggle chatting to him!  We would go back just to see Naveed and enjoy the ambience and friendliness!

This was our first time visiting and it lived up to its expectations and more! 

Thanks to Naveed and the whole team 

From two very happy English visitors 😊

title: Wrong credit card bookings - missing client communication
text:
The Plaza is a very beautiful hotel - but if you would like to get charged correctly it's the wrong place to stay.
Because of whatever reason, Plaza deducted wrong amounts from my credit card and in addition they have double charged for a minibar drink.

It took me 5 days to get at least a reaction on my emails.

Sorry, but I would not have expected such a low performance from a luxury hotel ... and I never have experienced until now.

It's also a pity that a communication channel for complaints could not be identified. The question for me is why ....

title: High Tea at The Plaza
text: High tea at the Plaza was an unforgettable experience. Every morsel was a work of art and equally delicious. Thank you, Kabir, for your kindness and for making us feel very special. We are so grateful.

title: A dream come true birthday experience!
text: Tea at the plaza was better than I could have ever imagined. Our server Muhibul was amazing and took such great care of us, especially with my dairy allergy. He went out of his way to make sure that the experience was special as it was my birthday and first time at the plaza. I felt like a complete princess. The atmosphere was beautiful, the food was exceptional, and the service was phenomenal. I couldn’t stop beaming. What an incredible and luxurious experience!

title: High tea
text: Wonderful experience, Fariz especially was very attentive and made our experience memorable, even gave us complimentary macaroons to takr home as part of our graduation celebration - can’t wait to come back.

title: Fariz at the Pal Court
text: Fariz at the palm court was amazing! So friendly and helped us pick which tea was right for us!! He provided excellent service and is the epitome of going above and beyond. Definitely ask for him if you can!

title: Impeccable
text: Had a wonderful time enjoying afternoon tea. Was perfect, the service was impeccable! Thank you to Fariz for being a wonderful host/server! My 8 year old loved every second of her Eloise experience :)

title: Amazing experience at the plaza
text:
We had a wonderful time. Fariz was very caring and helpful. The whole experience is worth it’s money. Really want to go again when I am back in the U.S.
The tea, the champagne and the food was so tasty. I highly recommend it, you won’t regret it :)

title: Great service
text: Shalim at the plaza was fantastic. When I finished my first pot of tea at our service, he asked what type I would be interested and came back with a blend of Darjeeling and chai. It was very fantastic.

title: Sublime experience
text: Lovely, simply lovely afternoon tea. Shalim Khan was a great server. A well executed tea. So pleased to have a vegetarian option (ask for the vegetarian menu). Will definitely return, perhaps with our family in tow next time. So nice to have a formal tea!

title: Once in a lifetime service, ambience, and experience
text: Afternoon Tea at The Palm Court is a once-in-a-lifetime experience.  Our server, Fariz Tello, was a true master of his craft.  From the pastries, to the tea, to the champagne, every bite and sip is the absolute pinnacle of luxury.  Worth every single penny.

title: The Plaza — a one of a kind gem
text: I had not been to the plaza for over 20 years and it did not disappoint. It remains my most favorite hotel in the world — not because of its timeless beauty — but because of the phenomenal service. Each of the Plaza service team members is warm, attention to detail, and proactively willing to help, which is what differentiates The Plaza from it’s also-exceptional competitors. Thank you for making my daughter’s 11th birthday (and more importantly, our time together) truly extraordinary.

title: Tea time at the Palm Court
text:
The sweetest experience celebrating my daughter's birthday with her best friend.
Loved the service, the ambiance and the food.
Fariz Tello, our server treated us like Family!
Hospitality at its best!!

title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING
text: The service and the food is great!!! Our waiter was Fariz Tello, an amazing man with a beautiful spirt and generosity. Dinning in a historical hotel with beautiful architecture made me feel like royalty. Such a special experience!!! Highly recommend!!!

title: Bucket List Experience
text: Tea at The Plaza’s Palm Court was a bucket list experience, and the staff made even more wonderful than we imagined. So complimentary and sparked conversation with us. We loved it! Thank you! A must go for tourists and locals

title: Exceptional service!
text: I had a staycation with my mom to celebrate my graduation and everything was amazing! Besides being an iconic NY landmark, the service was exceptional. Each person we interacted with was courteous, friendly, and made out experience all the better. One person in particular was Babul, our in room dining server.

title: 기대보다는 실망스러운 서비스, 위치는 좋음.
text:
유명한 것에 비해서 숙박의 경험이 그리 좋지 않았음. 네스프레소 커피 머신을 사용하는데 19달러를 받았고 커피 캡슐은 한번도 제공되지 않고 5개에 5달러씩을 받음. 방 안에 커피잔도 없어서 커피 머신을 요청한 경우에 가져다 주었음.  
complimentary물도 전화를 해야 가져다 주는 서비스에 약간 당황하였음. 
보통 이 정도 수준의 5성급 호텔은 welcome chocolate이라던다 밤에 evening service할때 캔디나 물, 등의 서비스가 있었는데 이 호텔은 3성급 비지니스 호텔의 느낌이었음.

title: A gem
text: Old but very clean and charming. Bathroom was spacious and beautiful with gold fixtures. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Good location in the center of the city. Prices were high but worth a treat,

title: Perfect
text: We had a very nice afternoon tea. The atmoshepere is amazing and so does the food. And special thanks to Kabir and Muhibul for making this afternoon tea more unforgettable. Thank you very much for lovely service.

title: I LOVE PLAZA NY
text:
Hotel magnifico, camera ampia ( avevamo una superior con vista ) , bagno ampio, ottima posizione.
Ci siamo tornati per la seconda volta , sempre insuperabile. Prezzi consoni a location e servizi offerti

title: The most special birthday experience.
text: Wonderful experience!! Delicious tea and the food was so special. Our server Shalim Khan was so nice and made the birthday celebration extra special. We will return again in the near future. We will come again.

title: Afternoon Tea
text: Had a wonderful experience at the iconic afternoon tea.  The service was impeccable and truly felt luxurious.  Our server, Fariz, was so friendly and kind.  He truly made our experience worthwhile.  While the experience is pricey, the food was tasty as well.

title: Great graduation celebration!
text: Went for afternoon tea at the Palm Court and everything was amazing! Our server Fariz Tello gave us great tea recommendations and was the best! Would definitely recommend for any occasion. It was a nice escape from the busy city life.

title: ネームバリューで選びました
text:
場所が最高なので、色々と便利でした。
誰もが知るホテルなので、タクシーなどでの移動もスムーズでした。
お部屋自体は古さを感じました、、ドライヤーのコンセントが外れかかっていて怖かったです。
バスルームは広く、洗面台も二つ、広めのバスタブもあったので快適でした。
コンシェルジュにも幾つかお願い事をしましたが、特に問題もなく、快適でした。
朝食は込みではなかったのですが、一度だけ頂きました、朝からなかなかのニューヨーク価格でした。
ウェイターさんが、子供のジュースを、子供がみていない間にこっそり追加して増やしてくれるサービスをしてくれて、ほっこりしました。

title: Palm Court afternoon tea
text: We celebrated a belated Mother’s Day with tea at the Palm Court - Fariz in particular made the experience so wonderful!  We enjoyed the delicious food, ambiance and incredibly friendly service. Being treated to surprise Plaza chocolates for Mom at the end of the meal was extra special.

title: Do not miss  T.E.A. The Extraordinary Atmosphere @ the plaza
text: I Surprised my daughter for THE famous tea experience for her graduation ( master @ NYU ). Fariz was extraordinary and made the celebration even more pleasant, Such an incredible gentleman ! The attention to detail was above my expectation and I have been to some of the most luxurious palaces around the world .

title: SHALIM IS THE BEST
text: Shalim Was great at the palm court! He Gave amazing wine recs and prefect flawless caring service. The room is obviously timeless and beautiful but some magic was lost in the details. There was marker on the front of the menu cover, and shmutz (maybe katchup from a previous guest) on the sugar tin. All in all a good experience.

title: Amazing way to spend an afternoon.
text: We had Afternoon Tea at The Plaza in the Palm Court. Our experience was nothing short of amazing. Our server Fariz was an absolute delight. Such opulent surroundings to enjoy a glass or two of champagne followed by beautiful food & a cup of brewed tea.

title: Mother's Day Tea
text: Fariz was absolutely wonderful! Went for Mother's Day tea with my mom and it was just such a wonderful pleasant experience! Will absolutely go again in the future! Everyone was so attentive and the tea and scones were delicious!

title: Afternoon tea dining
text: We were at the plaza Palms court for the afternoon tea dining. Fariz and Munibul made the experience extra special with a cute birthday present for my daughter. The service was excellent, the tea and food was amazing.

title: Iconic
text: Absolutely phenomenal! There’s a reason The Plaza is an icon and sets the standard of white-glove service. We stayed in a Pulitzer Suite, luxuriated in spa services, enjoyed dinner and high tea, did some shopping at the in-house jewelry store for reasonable prices. A great “staycation” in NYC and we definitely plan to return!

title: Rooibos lady very satisfied!
text: The afternoon tea was fabulous!  It was so elegant & everything was delicious!  Our server, Fariz Tello, was superb.  The entire experience was fit for a queen!  (And that’s exactly how we felt!). Treat yourself to this amazing experience!

title: Can’t miss experience in NYC
text: This experience was outstanding! I cannot say enough good about the service, atmosphere, the food & attention to every detail. It was a real treat & delight. It made me feel like a little girl again! Pay the money & make time to go! Fariz was an outstanding server. This place transports you back in time to a regal age with class & distinction.

title: Family high tea
text: Fresh sandwiches. Definitely an experience.  Shamim was a terrific waiter. Love the plaza   Life long New Yorkers and figured we should do high tea at the plaza once. Fun activity to do with the kids.

title: Drinkers at the Bar during Afternoon Tea
text: Had a lovely afternoon tea in the Palm Court today where the food and service were great . However a somewhat rowdy group of drinkers at the bar should have been dealt with in a more timely manner rather than being encouraged by the Bar Staff as took the edge off the ambiance.

title: The Palm Court - Tea Time
text: My husband and I had brunch in The Palm Court, at The Plaza hotel, and it was spectacular. We had ran 15 minutes late, but the host was gracious, and sat us down quickly. Our server, Fariz, did a phenomenal job at making our experience memorable. We were celebrating my birthday, but it had not been mentioned. However the attention to detail displayed by Fariz was exceptional. He over heard my husband wishing me a happy birthday, and surprised us with a small treat & candle at the end of our tea time. He was also very patient while we took our time to order and just overall, take in the experience. The food was also exquisite. We selected, The Plaza Signature Tea, from the Tea time menu. The presentation was beautiful, and the treats were delicious. I would definitely recommend.

title: Amazing
text: Our waiter Fariz Tello was AMAZING!  My granddaughter Eloise and I first came to New York to visit the plaza when she turned 6, because Eloise in the book was 6. My granddaughter is now 11 and for the first time we had tea. It was everything and more that we dreamt of, because of our waiter. We were able to create amazing memories that will last a life time and a tradition to pass on to generations.

title: Amazing food and fabulous service
text: Amazing food, fabulous service. Undoubtably one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. Ridiculously overpriced for the food that is served, but the atmosphere, grandeur and service by far makes up for it. Will be back next year.

title: Best Afternoon Tea Ever!
text: Shamim was the ABSOLUTE BEST!  He made us feel so welcome, comfortable and pampered!  He was the highlight of our day and sunny smile and warm disposition was terrific!!!  The menus selection was outstanding - abilutelu delicious!

title: Amazing High Tea with Teens
text: The Plaza has one of my favorite High teas but nothing beats the service. Fariz Tello, our server  was amazing with our 3 girls! Thank you for making our afternoon so memorable. We definitely will be back.

title: Wonderful!
text: Tea at The Palm Court was such a delicate and delicious breath of fresh air! The tea itself is exceptional, but the gluten free desserts were creative and special. We appreciated the service and were taken care of by Kabir.

title: Love the service at the Plaza
text: The service was excellent beyond words! Babal Chowdury, Paul the bellhop and Pat in Room Service, Freddie the doorman are all truly exceptional at what they do and we will return because of them! Thank you!

title: Incredible high tea
text: I had a high tea reservation on a Sunday and had the absolute best experience. That was my very first high tea and our server Fariz made sure it was a completely personalized experience. I was celebrating a birthday and he came out with a customized and personalized tea spread, champagne, and some additional sweets. He was extremely attentive and kind. The food was so delicious and there was a lovely variety. The tea was amazing as well. I had such an incredible time I will be coming back to celebrate big events and just for a splendid afternoon :) I couldn't pick a favorite item because it was all delicious

title: Dream come true!
text: I've always wanted to have tea at The Plaza. It was everything I hoped for and more! The champagne and caviar made it so special. Our server Kabir was so lovely and made sure it was a memorable experience.

title: Fantastic afternoon Tea at the Plaza
text: We went to tea at the plaza, service and food was absolutely great. They accommodated all of our allergies no problem and I will be going again! I recommend that you try some of the signature cocktails after your tea experience!

title: Plaza Stay
text: Excellent people and customer service. Great location. Very comfortable. Special shout out to Babul C. Great staff member who went above and beyond. Older experience but worth it for the history and was a fun time.

title: Perfect Plaza Afternoon
text: My mother and I had a wonderful afternoon tea to celebrate her birthday. Everything was delicious- especially the truffle scones! The ambiance was absolutely beautiful and relaxing. Our server Fairuz was a delight and made my mother’s day so special with special celebratory chocolates!

title: Jederzeit wieder
text: Das Plaza in New York liegt perfekt am Central Park in Manhattan. Große Zimmer,  leckeres Essen,  unmittelbar an der 5th Avenue und in geringer, fußläufig gut bewältigbarer Entfernung zu Broadway und Time Square. Nicht ganz billig, aber der Preis ist es wert

title: Great Location, Amazing Stay
text:
We had the most magical week at The Plaza!

The staff went out of their way to make it unforgettable.
The suite was incredible, just walking into the lobby each day was an experience
Would never stay anywhere else when visiting New York

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
Room small could not open left side closet doors due to furniture. Unable to access safe in that part of the closet
The hotel is beautiful, comfortable, and clean. Our courtyard facing room was peaceful. Perfect location
We will not stay anywhere else when we return to NYC

title: si poteva fare di SI PUò MIGLIORARE più
text: ho prenotato una camera matrimoniale superior  mi arriva una mail per fare prenotazione con un supplemento per una camera di livello superiore già con un prezzo fissato, io faccio reservation, quando arrivo li mi dicono che non c'era possibilità e mi propongono una camera per una notte con una maggiorazione di 1500 dollari per poi cambiare con una più piccola con maggiorazione di 1000 dollari. sul conto mi trovo innumerevoli tasse di vario genere che non sono riuscito ancora oggi a capire. non è meglio dire che la camera invece di 1000 dollari costa 1100 compreso tasse definite prima???? un hotel come il Plaza  si deve distinguere su tutto, soprattutto per la trasparenza. Nulla da dire sulla Location, sulla pulizia, sulla gentilezza dei dipendenti e sulla qualità di tutto. ma si può migliorare sulla trasparenza e tanto altro come sopra descritto.

title: Plaza knocks it out of the park!  Staff,particularly Evan and Rodman, went above and beyond!! Five stars!!
text: The team at the Plaza went above and beyond the expected five star level of service we expect and have received! Evan and Rodman added another level of service that is beyond exceptional!!  They went out of their way to manor every aspect of our stay completely comfortable.

title: Traveling with a one year old
text:
We stayed at the plaza while my husband was in NY for business. We were traveling with our one year old so we wanted to be close to the park. 

Evan was wonderful and always very professional when bringing food to our room. We appreciated his friendly kind nature. 

The doormen were sure to help us up an down the stairs with our stroller and that was also very helpful.

title: Lack of attenttion to service
text: The difference between a good hotel and a great one is the service the are far away from a luxury service everyones seems sad , from dinning to room service and room noise our stay was poor because they  are not willing to bring great service. Complain many times no one cares , ive noticed other guests complaining too. We went to the penninsula thats great service

title: Great hotel in a perfect location
text: We had a great stay at this hotel. The food was nice and the room nice and comfortable. The only downside is that in common with a lot of hotels in the US, you get very little complementary, I was very surprised to be charged $20 for a tea kettle and mugs whilst paying thousands for our stay.

title: High Tea
text: My mom and I had the best time at high tea celebrating her birthday. The atmosphere was beautiful, the food and tea was absolutely delicious and Shalim Khan was amazing! He took great care of us! :)

title: Easter Sunday at the plaza
text:
Shalim khan was such an excellent representative of the property. Made us feel at home, We can’t wait to come back. 

We spent our Easter here and couldn’t have chosen a better place. :) thanks! We will see you soon

title: Great service at the Plaza!
text: We stayed at the Plaza for Easter weekend with our three teenagers. We enjoyed Easter brunch in the Palm Court. Shalim Khan looked after us. The experience was exceptional. We were greeted by name. The kids were given bunny ears. A wonderful jazz trio set a joyous tone. The food was excellent and Shalim was very attentive to our needs.

title: Afternoon tea at the Plaza
text: We had afternoon tea in the Plaza. Fariz was just wonderful and made us feel like we were the only clients (disclaimer: it was full). The food was good, but not exceptional like we’ve would expected from the Plaza. The tea was delicious. The price value was a bit too high for what we’ve got.

title: Exquisite
text: Shalim took excellent care of us while we dined on the most delicious afternoon tea. Exceeded expectations! Such a treat celebrating family birthdays. Definitely recommended if visiting New York. Beautiful setting and ambience. Thank you Shalim for a great afternoon.

title: Beautiful experience at the Plaza!
text: Excellent food, service and ambiance! A wonderful vegetarian arrays of treats- the chai and rooibos al hamman teas were delicious. Our server Fariz was excellent- very detail-oriented and pleasant. Will be back for sure!

title: 31 dollars for a sad latte…
text:
I don’t mind paying for some added luxury / location / service, but I just ordered a small latte in a paper cup through room service: 31 dollars without service charge. If something so rudimentary  is so over priced, one starts to wonder where else one gets ripped off. To charge like that for 1 cup of coffee feels cheap and lacking class. 
I quite liked it here before…. Bummer.

title: One of the best hotels I ever stayed
text: Great service, comfortable rooms, mattress and pillows are amazing,  and food is delicious . Staff is friendly, room service delivers fast and amenities are the best . Not to mention great location close to park, museums and shopping. Highly recommend

title: Simply the best service!
text: The service is the best I have ever had, we got attended by Fariz Tello and it was absolutely amazing. I spent my birthday morning there and I would not have had it any other way. The tea at The Plaza is mind blowing, we had an Eloise tea menu and three Central Park tea. Every second spent  here at tea time at the Plaza was great. We leave here so so happy and grateful for the incredible service and the food. Simply Amazing

title: Amazing Time at the Plaza
text: This was such a great experience. Fariz was our host and he was amazing! Very attentive and super nice. We love him!!! 10 out of 10, would definitely recommend. Once in a lifetime experience and I am so glad I took the family here. The pricing definitely accounts for the delicious food and spectacular hospitality!

title: Amazing Mommy-Daughter Getaway
text: As always, my stay at The Plaza was exquisite. Truly a place that feels like home. Special thanks to Russell aka Buddy, Babul, Nick, Blake & Kevin who were so gracious to me & my daughter. From arrival with special treats sent to our room and a welcome note to the The Plaza Hotel made out of chocolate delivered right before our departure, every small touch was truly appreciated and magnificent.

title: Tea at Palm Court
text: Had tea at the Palm Court to celebrate my mothers birthday. I mentioned at the reservation and they came and sang to her and brought her some special desserts. Shalim gave us excellent service and made the day. It was pricey but a great experience for a special occasion.

title: Afternoon tea in Fariz’s section
text: One of the world’s great experiences, afternoon tea at the Plaza is only enhanced by the highest quality service if you are lucky enough to be seated in Fariz Tello’s section!  Fariz you are the best!

title: Good for kids
text: I went with my 3 kids, one of whom is vegan. They all loved the food and tea, as did I. The service was excellent. Our server, Shalim Kha, was great and super accommodating to our very specific needs.

title: Russell Fan Club!
text: We loved Russell at the champagne bar so much! He was so attentive to us and made us feel right at home. Throughout each day we’ve been here we’ve been thinking about coming back to the Plaza just to see him. He’s truly made our moments on this trip into memories.

title: Amazing service from all staff and great property.
text: Badly Chowdury with in room dining was fantastic. The food was delicious. The property is very luxurious and everything is clean and well cared for. Amenities in the room are high-end and the bed is very comfy.

title: Afternoon tea at the Plaza
text: Afternoon tea at the Plaza was a perfect finish to our trip to NYC from the UK. Fariz Tello who served us was amazing,  the atmosphere and attention to detail was spot on. Definitely worth a visit if you have time.

title: Amazing!
text: Excellent experience at Palm Court - High Tea.  First time at The Plaza! Girls had the Fabulous Eloise experience.  Ambience, music, service was great ! Love our server Fariz!!!  Highly recommend if visiting NYC!

title: Tea time
text: We went for tea and it was our first time. Fariz was awesome and made our experience memorable. The food and tea were great. The ambience and the music was Devine. Great experience and will recommend

title: Круто, советую всем
text: Мне все понравилось, было классно я почувствовала атмосферу Нью Йорка с высоты, и побывала в отеле где снимали один дома, это было, классно, я советую всем почувствовать эти эмоции которые я испытываю, классно, еда вкусная и много разных кафе поблизости

title: Servers rule luxury hotels, treat them well!
text: My room service server Babul Chowdury was amazing. I am a bit on the sickly side and when I travel I choose hotels where I can get what I might need and Babul made my morning. This is what I am talking about, being treated to the level of the expense. And treated like a human and not a credit card.

title: Fariz-incredible service
text: Fariz was incredible! So friendly and went above and beyond to make our experience memorable. He made excellent recommendations for our tea and menu selections. He checked on us frequently and made us feel like family.

title: Amazing afternoon!
text: Truly magical experience! Fariz made sure my 7 year old daughter had a memorable afternoon!  She said it was her best day ever! Definitely asking for Fariz when we come back. Cucumber sandwiches were amazing!

title: Incredible In Room Dining Service!
text: Babul was incredible! The epitome of a customer-minded associate - The Plaza is lucky to have him! Fully set up my table for a casual lunch and left absolutely no detail to chance, even taking the time to move chairs around so I could sit where I wanted. Thanks, Babul!!

title: Tea at the Plaza!
text: It was such an amazing experience! Our server was Fariz Tello and he was incredibly kind! The food was great and the tea was very delicious as well! Overall the whole experience was extremely enjoyable and I would 100% go here again!💕

title: Great staff!
text:
It was early morning and bumped into this guy in the corridor.  His name was Babul! 
It was very refreshing and his warm energy - reminds me why I chose this hotel. Friendly and passionate staff - it’s these sorts of people that make the difference.

title: A Tea To Remember
text: We had the best time at afternoon tea. This was a dream come true, and I felt like a real life Eloise. Our server was so kind, and gave the best recommendations. He even gave me some souvenir of chocolates, which made me feel so special. This is definitely a memory I will never forget.

title: My nieces 18th birthday!
text: I brought my niece to the Palm Court for high tea for her 18th birthday. The staff treated us like royalty. It was a beautiful experience for us both. I would specially like to say thank you to Stanley Hudson, the Palm Court Server Assistant,  for making this experience so special for my niece and for me!

title: Beautiful breakfast
text: Kazi made our brunch extra special! It was my sister’s 21st birthday and he made sure she was treated like royalty the entire time. The palm court was beautiful and the food was delicious. On our way out Kazi got a great picture of us!

title: Afternoon Tea with my BFF!
text: The Palm Court is amazingly beautiful, classy, fragrant, upscale, but not pretentious!   The ambiance was so calm and relaxing it was like we had traveled to a tropical island.  Fariz waited on us and we were so grateful to have him do so.  He was very attentive as well as courteous!  He catered to our every need.  Afternoon Tea was such a very lovely and memorable experience.  🌸🌼🌺

title: A Magical Day at The Tea Room
text: I had such a lovely time at the tea room. Fariz was so kind and hospitable. He truly made our experience! The food and tea was delicious. I will definitely be back and look forward to dining with Fariz again!

title: High tea at the plaza

title: Iconic. Checked off the bucket list.
text:
Staying at The Plaza during Christmas in NY was an absolute dream come true. The location can’t be beat, and the lobby, restaurants and bars are all so lovely. However, we have stayed at other nice NY hotels (Waldorf Astoria - RIP, the Langham, etc) and I was very surprised that the mini bar and snack options were lacking in the room. When we came down the hall at 4pm after checking in, there were many dirty trays outside of people’s rooms and an abandoned housekeeping vacuum leaning against a wall. Don’t get me wrong, I know they were coming back for it eventually but for the cost of the room, it was surprising. I was expecting the nicest of nice in all areas. Once we got in the room, the bathroom was gorgeous with all of the intricate gold details. But the lighting was definitely dark, so ladies keep that in mind when planning to do your makeup. It was definitely doable, just dark. Now this is what will make me sound extra.. but the toilet paper was SO ROUGH. I’m talking the cheapest ply you can get. Again, I normally don’t care at all about that sort of thing. But when you’re payint over $1k/night for a room, you figure the hotel could atleast buy some charmin. 

After this bucket list experience I realized that the Plaza is worth the price due to: it’s history, the fact that it is the most iconic hotel in NYC, the location, and the grandeur rooms and lobby. But if you’re expecting Four Seasons style amenities in the room, the newest and most techy room features, Vegas hotel minibar and snacks, you may want to look at a newer property.

title: Very disappointing, bad experience.
text:
I had been looking forward to afternoon tea at The Plaza Hotel for quite some time, we wanted to end our first visit to NYC in style with a really special treat.

Sadly, the whole experience left us feeling rather deflated and very disappointed. 

On a positive note, the champagne and food were very good. It was the rest of the experience that fell very short of our expectations.

The staff are sadly devoid of any charm or character. Most are cold and aloof with no real interest in providing anything close to good customer service.

The chap who tried to look after us asked after about 40 minutes if we had finished when we had half our food left on the rack and 2 pots of lovely hot tea still to drink.

When we said we hadn't finished, he ignored us and started to clear our table. He was rather confused when I told him again we hadn't finished.  

He just didn't listen to us and wanted us to leave ASAP to get someone else at the table.

It was very unprofessional and typical of how the management / staff know that they don't have to try that hard to maintain a good reputation as business will always be pretty good because of the reputation of The Plaza Hotel.

$400 for 2 afternoon teas is far from cheap but I have to say, based on my experience, it was nowhere near fair value.

I wouldn't recommend going here. The staff just don't care about you or your experience. The whole thing is just a money-making operation.

I much preferred the afternoon tea at Bergdorf Goodman.

title: Beautiful hotel and impeccable service. Just thought they'd go above and beyond when I had a smokey experience!
text:
I arrived solo to celebrate an early Birthday while holidaying in the big apple. Decided to treat myself to this amazing, reputable hotel. Room was splendid, 18th floor, loved the finishings and style, huge shower and tub and hot water! Exemplary service from each and every person I spoke with or who assisted. 5 star all around there for kindness. 
I'll admit the meals are way overpriced for what you get. At least stand out if you're going to offer same food other restaurants have and charge triple for them... Like a lobster roll with French fries... Came out warm instead of hot, fries were mediocre. Then a ceasar salad was $65 delivered to my room. They charge $10 just for delivery then you feel obligated to give a tip... For a salad, without meat, and buns that were hard and stale! 
So besides that, still glowing with excitement, and everything was super perfect until later at night when I'd paid 21 for a movie and was in the last 30 min when I started to smell smoke... Well pot to be exact. I thought I could handle it but I noticed a fancy sign stating that it's a non smoking hotel and anyone caught would be fined 1500. So I called the front desk.. I was devastated as I couldn't handle it as it makes me so sick and I'm allergic and get sore throats right away from it... Took about an hour in total to have someone come investigate, confirm I wasnt out of my mind, and then move me to a new room. Lower floor, still no view, but a suite which was of no use to me since I had to check out early in the morning. So I had to pack everything up and couldn't go anywhere as it was late and I was already dressed for bed so had to stick it out until they moved me. Then had to unpack everything again and made me go to bed much later than I wanted to. 

Just really unfortunate for my only night there... And what didn't sit overly well with me is that upon check out, they never did anything else to make up for the inconvenience it caused... At any other hotel, fine, but at a Fairmont, at that price I have to work hard for to afford... Just disappointing. But I know it wasn't their fault and the staff did the best they could, I guess I had just hoped they would have gone above and beyond, especially cause now I'm sick 🤮. I'd of course still recommend the hotel though!

title: We absolutely love this hotel!
text: My family and I travelled from Ireland for a return stay in this wonderful hotel in late December 2022. Matsumi in Concierge efficiently organised a hotel car to pick us up from JFK and Ben was a wonderfully punctual and friendly driver. Russel at Reception gave us a very warm welcome and checked us in efficiently. The room was superb as one would expect. Overall, the hotel looked magnificent and the Christmas decorations were amazing. Breakfast in the Palm Court was wonderful and we were delighted to be served once again by Proferio and  Babu who were exceptionally professional and really nice to our kids. All the staff whom we encountered in the hotel were absolutely lovely. Babu can do wonderful tricks with a napkin which was really entertaining and our children absolutely loved it! Check-out was super quick and no fuss. Tony, the doorman, arranged our transport to the airport and was always polite and friendly during the many, many times that we entered and exited the hotel. Ted was also very helpful and knowledgeable. Being so close to the shops on Fifth Avenue was super handy for dropping bags back to the hotel. Last but not least, Loai at Reception was fantastic and we were delighted to see him again following a previous stay in April 2022. Overall, it was an excellent stay and we look forward to returning in the summer of 2023.

title: Lovely place, but we came a little too late/soon
text: I enjoyed a one-night stay with my daughter during the holiday season. We had requested the upgraded accommodations for an additional fee (if available). Upon our arrival, we were surprised that there was no one to greet us at the door or help with our luggage. Anyone could walk right in. When we checked in (we were a little early and didn't expect our room would be ready, which was fine as there were plenty of sights to see), we were pleasantly greeted, and the kind young lady let us know that they would be able to honor our upgrade; however, it wouldn't be ready until after noon. No problem! We went to Mass and, on our walk back, received a call that our room was ready - much earlier than we'd expected. When we walked to the door of our room, there was a vacuum cleaner left in front of it. Not exactly what you'd expect when paying an exorbitant nightly fee. Upon entering our room, we discovered we did not receive the upgrade; it was the room we'd originally booked. I mentioned this to the bellman when he brought up our luggage, and his response was, "oh, it's a very large room, though." It was a nice room, so fine enough; we'd end up sharing a bed instead of having two beds as we would with the upgrade. It also had a large terrace, but I had problems locking the terrace door, so I asked the bellman for assistance. He spent 10 minutes showing me how to operate the "tricky" door, but it never did lock. I did not feel safe, especially since it connected with the terrace next door and was so close to the neighboring building. The tv provided access to all the services, but when I went to use them, it said I wasn't checked in, so I had to "chat" with the concierge to get it activated. I also inquired about a late checkout since we had a later flight but received no response. We went for our spa services and tea. The tea experience was terrific, and we highly recommend it. The gluten-free option was wonderful! The spa services were nice (massage and facial), but nothing set it apart from any other spa. The staff in all areas were extremely kind and accommodating. That night, we ordered the Home Alone sundae - "16 scoops of assorted ice cream." Hold onto your hats; we received the smallest scoops of only chocolate and vanilla ice cream. We were a bit disappointed. I'm glad I also ordered a steak dinner because that was amazing, and although room service said they were running a little behind, ours was delivered within minutes. I pushed the button for room service to retrieve our table, but no one ever came, so I just muscled the table into the hall. Let's talk about the bed: the most comfortable ever! We did ask for extra blankets because we required a little extra bundling that night. That was no problem. The next morning I ordered room service for breakfast. Again, they warned that they were running behind. This time they took well over an hour, and everything was cold when it arrived. This delay really set us back from checking out. Housekeeping had asked when we were checking out. I asked if 14:00 was okay, and she said yes, but at 12:20, the butler was knocking at our door, asking when we could be out. He could see I was frantically trying to get packed and told me to take my time, but it would've been nice if we could've just had the late checkout I had inquired about initially. Then, as I was waiting at the airport and reviewing my hotel invoice, I noticed that none of the spa credits that came with my package were reflected in the invoice. So, I spent a good amount of time on the phone getting that sorted out. It is a lovely hotel, and the people are so incredibly kind. The overall experience is not quite at the level I had expected. I'm going to blame the timing because I can see where perfection once was. Unfortunately, our visit came post-pandemic and during the busiest time of year, but we're fortunate to have visited at all.

title: The plaza hotel Christmas time
text:
Me and my wife went during Christmas time and stayed at the plaza hotel. We wanted to experience the home alone experience we thought about getting the home alone Sunday but it was $300 and we didn’t think it was worth it. We ended up just getting regular ice cream sundaes instead which we were happy we didn’t get the home alone Sunday because the smaller Sundays  ice cream was freezer burnt and kind of nasty. The room service food was cold and took extremely long to arrive Besides, that the hotel was amazing the staff was very friendly. The weight staff at the bar were extremely nice and we had a long conversation. The drinks are just a little over priced I was charged $35 for a rum and Coke. I understand it’s an upscale hotel but a drink like that nature should be $20 and maybe under.  My overall opinion, the Hotel gets an eight out of 10 I take two points off for the room service food in the oven trays drinks at .my overall opinion, the Hotel gets a eight out of 10 I take two points off for the room service food & over priced drinks. title: Excellent tea experience!
text:
Beautiful setting, friendly and attentive service, delicious food and tea. This is the experience one expects when doing afternoon tea. Very pleased! It was slightly fast paced compared to other teas, but I wouldn't consider it rushed (I'd say just fairly efficient, as I imagine they need to be). We splurged on a couple of cocktails each in addition to the tea and just had a great time. Two small criticisms..despite foie gras being banned in New York, they still had it on the menu. It was in the form of a macaron included in the savory portion; it was not delicious anyway (the only unpleasant item, actually...I wasn't expecting it to be really sweet). Also, the restrooms are located quite far and only one working stall in the ladies' room, which isn't ideal when we're all drinking tea and cocktails.

Overall, there was a lot of food, and all but the foie gras macaron was simply outstanding. The tea was delicious too (and they had so many options to choose from). Couldn't have asked for a better tea experience. Totally worth it. Book early!

title: Entry issues
text: My parents were guests at The Plaza for Christmas. There were lots of non-guests seeking to access the lobby to take selfies. The doormen were trying to stop them getting in, but if you weren’t staying there (like us) and didn’t have a key card, it was incredibly annoying trying to get in. Rather than have a guest list (and/or a list of people visiting hotel guests) the doormen had no list and just asked a series of questions to determine if you were allowed in (a bit like customs on arrival at an airport - but with the suggestion that giving a tip each time would grease the wheels). This wasted time and was just annoying. It was also ineffective as there were plenty of non-guests without key cards using the elevators to access the hotel (relying on other guests using their key cards first, before selecting a floor). It should be better organized.
