title: Tea at the Plaza
text: My wife and I brought our daughter in for morning tea to celebrate her becoming a Radio City Rockette!  Our server, Shalim, was awesome!  In addition his manager, Robert, came by to chat and was incredibly nice and accommodating.  The Plaza, and the entire team, knocked the cover off the ball!

title: Go for the experience, not the food!
text: We visited The Plaza for breakfast and enjoyed the experience for the most part. The building is beautiful, staff are very attentive. However, for the price, the food was very disappointing.I probably wouldn’t return! It’s a been there, done that kind of place. I could have had a better breakfast on Times Square for a lot less!

title: I ll come back again, and again :)
text:
Perfect position, best services, don't forget to give tips anywhere :). Is NY!
I'm not for the first time în this hotel, never disapointed.
I stay in the room nr 1231 for 4 nights, very clean, 2 times /day cleaning.
Minus:  towels a bit too old, noisy, windows are not perfect sealed, but not too much to complain.
A lot of fresh flowers în the loby, a nice historical building, a very prompte and professional concierge.
I will come again!

title: Top Upper East Side Hotel
text:
I again stayed a The Plaza in June for a business trip and wasn't disappointed. Spacious rooms, flawless service, central location (if you need to be at the Upper East Side or Midtown). 

In particular, I'd like to single out, and praise, Hatsumi from the Concierge team, who always manages to get the restaurant tables I want.

I'll definetely will be back.

title: Silochan
text:
I had the best tine celebrating my birthday.
The staff amd the workers were all very professional amd kind in their job and speaking to you. They are all always ready to help you in any way shape or form.
The hotel was always very clean and well put away.

title: Sister's Birthday
text: For my sister's birthday this year I decided to take her to the Plaza for afternoon tea last Sunday. We had the pleasure of being served by Muhibul. From start to finish it was a beautiful experience. The ambiance, decor and service exemplified class, as would be expected from the Plaza. Muhibul went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Giving us recommendations for his favorite teas (an almond blend I would have never thought to try) and checking on us made us feel so welcomed. The scones,  finger sandwiches and deserts were all delicious. Thank you for a great experience and a very memorable birthday celebration.

title: The Plaza New York Champagne Bar
text: We had a wonderful stay at The Plaza, a lifetime dream for me personally. The hotel is beautiful, the staff are friendly, efficient and welcoming. Special mention goes to Narendra ‘Nick’ Nathani who looked after us in the bar but also went ‘above and beyond’ to make our stay even more special for which we are very grateful.

title: The palm court
text: Great place and amazing service!  Bartender Kenny at the Palm Court is amazing !  Great service and great person . The food and wine menu is excellent. Highly recommend this place if your looking for upscale.

title: The worst afternoon tea experience i've ever had.
text:
After being seated a waiter came over with menus. We began to look at cocktail choices and were told that we should leave that and just decide on which tea selection we wanted as they stopped serving at 4pm (it was 3.30pm and we had booked weeks in advance)
He brought out water and slopped it in to our glasses and on to the table - which he didn't clear away. Brought the stand with sandwiches, desserts etc on and unceremoniously dumped it on the table. The bowls of cream and jam came with no spoons for transferring them so we had to use our knives which isn't practical for a few reasons. He never asked us during this time if we would like to order the cocktails that we had expressed an interest in. In fact getting anyone's attention was nigh on impossible. The sandwiches were hard and dry - certainly not made fresh. The sweets were just that - sweet. They looked pretty but didn't taste as good. The tea was brought out in huge pots (I'm talking family sized teapots) which for one person was just ridiculous. The waiter then reached across in front of me and my plate to pour it in to my cup without a word, 
 forcing me to lean back considerably and the tea had not had time to soak in to the water let alone brew. 
Basically, very poor service and a less than average tea which cost a small fortune. I would not recommend it to anyone at all.

title: Champagne Bar Server
text: Nick was our favorite server at the  Plaza! Always so happy and helpful. He made our family feel right at home and gave us great tips on anything we asked him about. We will definitely be back to see our new friend!!!

title: Miss
text: I had an excellent time and staff were extremely accommodating nothing was too much trouble and always stopped to have a conversation. Narendra (Nick) Nathani was especially lovely and always went out of his way to help us and make the whole experience one of a kind. The hotel was beautiful and the room was always clean to perfection. Not to mention how gorgeous the bathroom was! I would recommend this hotel to absolutely anyone!!!

title: Tea in the Palm Court for my Birthday
text: Shalim Khan at the Palm Court was fabulous. It was my 28th birthday and I asked if I could do the Plaza tea service in the Eloise Tea set. He made the dreams of my 6 year self come true! It was truly magical!!

title: Kenny is AMAZING!!!
text: If you’re staying in New York City and go to the Plaza Hotel, you absolutely need to stop by the bar and ask for Kenny! He is the most personal bartender I have ever met, he made our night absolutely wonderful! Best person I have met in NYC so far! Great recommendations, great drinks, and  great conversations! Love him!❤️❤️

title: Mother's Day Tea
text: What a memorable experience to have tea at the Plaza on Mother's Day.  My daughter and I had a great time.  The tea, drinks and food were delicious.  We even took home some of the leftovers.  Service was impeccable.

title: Lovey hotel but the drapes were torn
text:
The plaza was something of a contradiction for us. Fabulously opulent in almost all ways but the voile and drapes in our room were tatty. The voile panels had holes in them and the drapes needed some repairing.
The bathroom was delightfully beautiful with Guerlain products.
Bed linens were nice and aircon was fab.
Staff were wonderful and very attentive.
If you go, be aware that they charge $250 a DAY to your card when you check in for 'incidentals' and revert the payment once you have checked out - for us it took a week to get the $750 payment back on our card. It was our spending money :-( And there are taxes on everything. Breakfast one morning cost us $120 for toast, orange juice, coffee, avocado and cereal. Just be aware, as we were not and it came as a shock. 
Having said that, we DID enjoy our stay. Concierge and reception staff were wonderful. The guys that work in the Champagne bar are professional and lovely. And the main downstairs areas are very beautiful.
It was great to stay somewhere iconic and special but we wouldn't stay again

title: The worst stay ever
text:
We stayed for 5 nights, it was the worst experience we had. the rooms were spacious but the carpets were stained and dirty. House keeping  were very  they don’t even clean the dustbins unless you ask!!!! They do the beds but never place the pills in the right place and when they were asked to change the pillows to allergy free the pillows they brought were stained with dark spots looks like blood, when I told them to change they apologized saying they id not notice, which means pillows are never cleaned.
For all our stay whenever we go to the palm court for breakfast they say the place is full though there are many empty tables an direct us to the other restaurant in the next to the reception, finally in our last day they gave the same answer and I was furious saying there are many empty tables and we are jus 2 persons they sated us, it took them 45 minutes to bring the wrong order of just plain fried eggs and toast!!!
During our stay the elevators were not working and just one was, but I was not sure why housekeeping and room service use the same only elevator with the residence I assume such big hotel should have service elevators.
I believe the management is careless or weak and has no power over employees.
The door men were there but doing nothing
The reason we picked this hotel is that we could not find reservations at the Pierre were   we normally stay 
Over all the place and service dose not worth the amount paid.
I will never come bak nor recommend.

title: Afternoon tea
text: A small group of us went to experience afternoon tea at The Palm Court. We each enjoyed the Manhattan Tea which was delightful. The service and ambiance was spectacular. The amount of food was plentiful and we left full and happy. I would happily return and recommend to anyone. The cost of tea is high (starting at $110 per person) but is worth the experience.

title: Daughter’s birthday
text: Wonderful experience in an exquisitely classic place. Russell and Tony in lobby bar were beyond friendly and welcoming.  Espresso martini was tip top and my daughter and I had an unforgettable time together. Well done Plaza!

title: Go See Kenny at The Champagne Bar!
text:
I stopped into the Plaza Hotel for a quick drink and look-around, as I was short on time, but in the area. 

I was able to snag the last seat at The Champagne Bar where Kenny, the STARtender took care of me. He was super friendly, funny and very knowledgeable about all types of champagne and many other cocktails. I definitely learned a few new things while chatting with him. 

I HIGHLY recommend having a drink at the Plaza for some good company and great conversation. Ask for Kenny!

title: Afternoon tea
text: We had a wonderful time as we experienced afternoon tea at The Plaza. It exceeded our expectations. Our server, Muhibal made us feel so special and attended to our needs -down to the last detail. We will definitely be back.

title: Amazing stay
text: We had a fabulous experience. The staff has been so attentive, and everyone received special attention. We had our children with us, and they were so accommodating, made our visit that much better and easier.

title: Vacation
text: We loved our stay at the Plaza. The king room was very comfortable and had a nice limited view of Central Park. Every meal was excellent. The staff were very conscientious and thoughtful. The concierge team helped us several times find great restaurants for lunch or dinner. Just an overall wonderful experience.

title: Vacation
text: We had a great time with Shalim. He is very attentionated and helped us with every little details. We had the imperial menú and everything was delicious. We highly recommend this beautiful place, and we will be back.

title: Great Experience
text: Stayed at The Plaza from July 9-12.   Beautiful room, great service from housekeeping, front desk and concierge.  Enjoyed drinks and lunch at Palm Court where Russell was a great bartender who offered helpful hints on what to do while in New York and suggested some excellent choices for both food and drinks.  Thanks Russell!

title: Excellent service at Champagne Bar lobby bar
text:
I live in CT and went to the city to meet up with a friend who was in town for her birthday. A mandatory stop was a hotel lobby bar, and we decided on the Plaza. Not realizing so much of the hotel is closed (one of the lobby bars, the Oak Room, and the food hall), we were delighted to see the Champagne Bar was still open.
What made this stop incredible was the bartender, Kenny Wong. He was just fabulous--fun, funny, attentive, professional--couldn't ask for a better one! My friends and I stayed longer than we intended, just relaxing, chatting, and enjoying the atmosphere. Iconic NYC, a must-do on your next trip! (Also a plug for their high tea, which I haven't done in 20 years but am sure it's still amazing...!)

title: Nice for a special occasion!
text: The experience was relaxed and enjoyable. The treats were tasty and plenty of food for two. Our server, Shalim, was prompt, courteous and kind.  We went there to have tea for my birthday and it was a nice experience. It was a bit pricey but it was nice for a special occasion.

title:
Lee Morgan and a 1972 Winter:
Russell and Carlos
text: Russel and Carlos at the Plaza bar were fantastic. Extremely hospitable and made the customer feel distinguished but also at home. I would highly recommend to most of you are just looking for and enjoyable time around friends. Both Carlos and Russell know when to join in on a conversation and when to stay out letting them customer feel in safe spot to talk to their friends and family.

title: High Tea at the iconic Plaza Hotel NYC
text: We enjoyed a very warm welcome from your team. The high tea was wonderful. We received excellent service from Shalim especially, he was very kind & attentive during our visit. It was a wonderful experience and I would definitely recommend it!

title: Porfirio is Amazing!!!
text: porfirio was absolutely incredible. he made our entire experience memorable! we try and request him every time we visit because he is dedicated to providing the best service possible and making our time enjoyable and special. his attention to our table was immaculate, he never let our glasses become empty and always anticipated any of our needs. 5 star service! he is hands down our favorite member of the plaza team and we can't wait to return!

title: Need major updates
text: We would definitely not stay in the Plaza hotel again. You pay for the name and popularity of this hotel and not for service and comfort! This hotel needs major updates! Such as refurnish all furniture and so on. Also, this hotel needs to be deep clean! We stay there a whole week and they didn’t vacuum the hallways for the entire week. Also, the carpets in rooms were so dirty! And last but not least, somebody stole money from our hotel room! So upset!

title: A nice High tea getaway from Meetings all day!
text: Thank you to Muhibul for taking my mind off my busy day and helping me escape for a sec. Your tea recommendation was just what I needed. I hope everyone takes the time to step away from a busy day like I did. Truly appreciated…

title: Guest
text: Amir makes the best cappuccino and gave great service! I appreciate the extra touch and care in the presentation. From the moment you walk in the champagne bar, the smell of gardenias, the vintage aesthetics…all take you back to another period in time. Exactly what you’d expect from the Plaza!

title: Afternoon Tea
text: We had the vegan afternoon tea. It was absolutely amazing. Our waiter Kabir was amazing. He took really great care of us from making sure everything was perfect. The food was so tasty and detailed. We even met the chief who prepared all the sandwiches and treats. If your visiting New York highly recommend. Ask for Kabir

title: Fourth of July
text: This hotel is spectacular. When you enter the hotel, the fresh smell of Lillie’s is unforgettable. The staff is present but not intrusive. Would recommend visiting the champagne bar and asking for Alam. Order the Billecart-Salmon Rose!

title: Great service
text: Very attentive. Very caring and took care of us.   Joey/Jose was amazing at the champagne  bar !!!     Very helpful.  Great with kids.   So good with recommendations.   Very helpful.   Great worker. He is attentive. Caring. Thoughtful.    Great employee

title: Wow. An incredible experience!
text: Shalim attended to every detail to make our visit exceptional. We had some food allergies and he made modifications to ensure our safety. He also read the note in the reservation regarding my daughter’s upcoming 16th birthday. They sang and presented her with a signature box of chocolates. Stanley was also wonderful and answered all of our questions about the hotel. We will definitely come back. Thank you Shalim and Stanley for a wonderful experience!

title: Lots of hidden charges
text: The hotel charges a $60 surcharge per day that is not displayed into the headline nightly rate, even though you must pay it per day (therefore, it's borderline fraud that it's not calculated into the rate you are shown on booking, but instead buried into notes). Of this daily surcharge, the hotel gives you a $50 per day on a use-it-or-lose-it basis. There's no way of getting out of this fee, but it isn't shown to you in the nightly rate. Unfair business practice operating at the Plaza. The fee has been in place since 2018 and as you can see from reviews, it's deeply onpopular.

title: Manhattan Tea just like Eloise
text: We had a wonderful time and the service was impeccable. Truly a bucket list experience.  Nice to slow down and sip tea, eat treats and enjoy the ambiance with my teen. Lovely opportunity to dress up, enjoy a quiet moment together and enjoy the beauty of this historic place.  The food was delicious, simply phenomenal pastries, and the services was flawless.  Thank you to Kabir Ahmed - our server.

title: High Tea did not meet expectations
text: We finally got in for high tea after trying so many times and the scarcity of reservations probably served to boost our expectations too high. The room, while beautiful, has very tight seating which is a little alarming during a pandemic. The tightness of seating, large volume of people, and acoustics, makes for a very loud and harried experience which really runs cross-purpose of a high tea. Another simply shocking element is the fact that the restrooms are located on the floor above and the women’s room has only two stalls which creates a long line of frustrated women waiting outside and occasionally commandeering the Men’s room. The tea was good and the sandwiches and sweets were average.

title: Great Stay
text:
Dream come true experience from start to finish. 
The Plaza staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome. 
This was my families first visit to New York City and it was an all around unforgettable experience. We will definitely be staying here, should we visit NY again!

title: Afternoon tea birthday celebration
text: We had a wonderful time at afternoon tea. Shalim Khan took wonderful care of us. He was patient and also brought a out a birthday surprise. It was our first time and we will definitely be back! Thank you!

title: amazing experience
text: The hotel is AMAZING! Inside and outside, a real gem! The people at the reception are really helpful and nice, the housekeeping are one of a kind - the best people I ever met in my life, the spa personnel happy and calm - just as you would …

title: Worst five star Hotel in New York City
text: Worst room service ever 5 star ⭐️ hotel with no coffee machine in room cause you have to pay extra for a freaking coffee machine it’s year 2022 people it’s crazy plus you need to call every time to get creamer and coffee refill plus get ready to wait for that more than a hour for 3 days in row REALY not worth the price or the hype they can learn a lots from the four season hotel

title: The plaza
text:
Wonderful service from Nick at the hotel bar! So accommodating and polite. Beautiful ambiance and vibe. 
The salad and rose were delicious and wonderful.
Will definitely be coming back to stay and can’t wait!

title: A Must do for tea for afternoon tea fans!
text: What an absolutely wonderful tea!  First before I write about our food, I must give credit where credit is due.  Our server Mr. Porfirio Cortes was amazing. He took loads of photos of us, even managing a paparazzi pose while doing so.  We wanted for nothing, perfect service.  There is an actual tea menu (several pages in fact!) and I was unsure which tea to order.  His recommendation was spot on.  We chose the Plaza menu, and we were not disappointed.   Everything (Hail to the Chefs) on our tower of treats, scones, and sammies, and sweets (oh my) were scrumptious and more than the 2 of us could finish.  We took several pastries back to our hotel.  We were well satiated.  And not to be thought of last, The Plaza is a stunningly beautiful hotel, and The Plaza Court is gorgeous!  Do not hesitate to go if your budget allows.

title: Incredible Mother’s Day
text: This is a belated review, but we stayed at the Plaza for one night as a Mother’s Day staycation a month ago, and it was an unforgettable experience. I’ve stayed at (and even worked in) some of the finest hotels in the world, and this was one of the finest. The space, the amenities, and the staff were all phenomenal. Patrick went out of his way to make sure our stay was comfortable (2 adults and 1 infant), and he truly went above and beyond. We’ve already chosen the Plaza as our go to for special occasions, and can’t wait to return!

title: Afternoon tea at the plaza hotel
text: My parents and I had the time of our lives enjoying high tea at the Plaza. It was a spontaneous splurge (be ready to drop some $$), but the service and presentation was beautiful. The dessert tier looked like something out of a fairy tale. Shalim, the man who attended to us, was friendly and made our outing even better than it would have otherwise been.

title: Brilliant. Our stay here made our trip to NYC
text: Wanted to stay here for ages. The reality beat expectation. Nice balance of luxury, history and friendliness. Great location. Superb suite, warm welcome and attentive staff. Loved our stay. It kinda made our trip to NYC

title: The sweetest, sweet 16 stay 💕
text:
We planned our stay at The Plaza to celebrate our daughter’s sweet 16 birthday, we could not have dreamed of a more perfect stay at such an iconic hotel with the absolute best location. We were greeted immediately with utmost hospitality by all of the staff, especially Mr. Brigano. He truly went above and beyond and made my daughter’s Sweet 16 more than she could have ever dreamed of. We knew celebrating her sweet 16 at The Plaza would be amazing, but meeting Mr. Brigano made it unforgettable. He was an absolute pleasure and he made our stay the most wonderful birthday celebration it could possibly be. Sweet sixteen is such a milestone birthday and Mr. Brigano added special touches throughout our stay that made such a difference, we felt like we’d known him all of our lives. 

Everything at The Plaza is exceptional, from the extravagant rooms, the elegance you feel when walking in and especially the attentive staff. We also had the pleasure of dining at the Palm Court, our dinner was delicious and our server was attentive, even bringing our daughter a gift after hearing it was her birthday. Every inch of The Plaza contains the most elegant decor, the most fabulous details, and most of all the friendliest staff that make you feel like family. We are already planning a trip back, luckily I have the room spray and candle to remind me of my all time favorite place! 

Well done Plaza Hotel and Mr. Brigano, until next time!! ❤️

title: Morning Made Better at the Palm Court
text: I started my morning with plans of eating at the Palm Court at the Plaza, but was having one of those days where I was foggy and not totally there. Usually I would feel self-conscious when I’m so not myself. Thankfully I was assisted immediately by Kayin Lewin. His amazing service and attitude made me not only feel welcome but immediately cheerful. I am excited to return to the Palm Court and see Kayin soon!

title: Dovrebbero fare attenzione ai particolari
text: Ottimo albergo ..camera piano alto..con vista mozzafiato... sebbene  ci sia  un ottimo arredamento .francamente .mi aspettavo di piu ..considerando  il prezzo della  camera...l albergo e situato in un ottima posizione ..molto bello ...la colazione ed il servizio piu che buoni ..ma ...non all altezza  di quello che ci si aspetta da un albergo di questo livello..credo che sia necessario un attenzione migliore ai particolari..peccato

title: A Good Visit
text: The Plaza is historic and beautiful. While we enjoyed the stay, I would not stay there again for the price. I have stayed in much nicer accommodations for less. The location is good, but the room was very basic and underwhelming for what we were expecting.

title: Birthday
text: Had a great time . My daughter felt like a princess. Staff is amazing. Rooms are beautiful. Food is delicious.  Loved the location. Took a carriage ride in Central Park which is located right across the street.

title: Champagne Bar
text: Excellent stop. Kenny, the bartender, was superb!Bc of his conversation, we bought several drinks. I highly recommend it. Kenny recommended several NYC activities. The Plaza is a beautiful hotel. Thx.

title: Excelente
text:
Increíble atención, muy amables y muy rico todo. El lugar es increíble. Fue una experiencia totalmente inolvidable y lucinante. 
Espero tener la oportunidad de volver algún día ya que fue muy buena la atención del personal

title: Drinks at the Palm Court Bar
text: My mother, sister and I had a lovely afternoon filled with delicious oysters, cake, Cristal and other goodies. All served by the even more lovely Russell! Highly recommend! Great for special occasions.

title: Nick
text: Nick was a dream! Made our tea so special and memorable   He listened to my allergies and brought out our food to go just like we needed. Thank you so much, Nick! You made our day and our friends wedding with your style

title: Calm in the City
text:
The hotel, as you would expect, is beautifully decorated and maintained. There is an ambiance of elegance and quality. Details are well attended to…

The staff is attentive, professional and courteous. One associate represents The Plaza especially well. We had the pleasure of meeting Mr. Matusic on a number of occasions at the Champagne Bar.  He was knowledgeable, pleasant and happy to accommodate our requests. He made our experience feel more like a welcoming visit than just a client/employee exchange. 

If there was any disappointment it is that many of the amenities that were available pre-Covid have not re-opened. The small shops, cafes, etc. remain closed. Overall we were very happy and plan to stay again in the future.

title: Afternoon Tea-Experience worth Prioritizing
text:
Kazi was a wonderful host during an afternoon tea with my best friend -commemorating our Grad school graduations. He showed us how to blend our tea, and took great photos of us before we even asked. 
We both ordered the Manhattan Tea, and had 0 regrets. Every bite was heavenly and I finally lived out my dream of feeling like Eloise at the Plaza. 
Price ended up being about $160 each. We went for an 11am reservation and it wasn’t too packed at all. Definitely enough food to serve as ‘brunch’. 
It’s also right across from Central Park, so we arrived early and hung out there before going into the hotel to take some photos and use the restroom in the lobby before checking into our reservation. 
There’s also a luxury bookstore at the second floor of the lobby which was fun to browse through. Hopefully 1 day I can buy one of the massive $700+ coffee table books. 
An experience worth prioritizing. I live in Massachusetts, and the 4.5 hour drive the day before made it super doable too!

title: Tea at the Plaza
text: We had a wonderful time at the Plaza. It was my daughter’s first time having afternoon tea and our server, Porfirio, made our experience whimsical! We loved the Manhattan tea service which included savory and sweet bites! We will return!

title: Champagne bar
text: The champagne bar at the plaza is beautiful and the bartender Kenny is the best bartender in Manhattan. We ordered the imperial plaza and it was delicious. Kenny was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about all the things to see and do in NYC. I would come back to the plaza just to see Kenny again

title: Past it’s sell by date. Old and tired
text:
We were originally going to book this hotel as my daughter is named Eloise , this was to be a celebration visit so it seemed apt to stay at her name sake Eloise at the Plaza by the Park . I was about to book when the travel agent commented that the Hard Rock Hotel group were opening a new hotel in New York. We didn’t give it a second thought and booked the Hard Rock and was so pleased we did ( read my review of the Hard Rock Hotel New York ) 
We popped over to the Plaza for lunch and was so glad we did not book this hotel. The seats in the dining area were incredibly dirty. You could see the dirt and grime on the back of all of the soft furnished chairs. Not one or two but all of them. Disgusting. Enough to turn you off your food. The bathroom was not much better. Dirty and smelly. I couldn’t believe the mosh mash of the bathroom. Nothing matched. Old brass taps with chrome pipe work . Toilet paper everywhere. To think we nearly booked this hotel. If the dining area , cocktail bar and bathroom was this bad I dread to think what the bedrooms were like. I think we had a lucky escape. This hotel will use the excuse that it is undergoing an overhaul , yes may be but that is no excuse for dirty chairs and bathrooms.

title: Poor performance and attitude
text:
Afternoon tea, $140 per person, overall a let down, the reasons being,

Whilst eating a kitchen porter pushed teapot trolley through the dining area stacked 5ft high.

Staff member  broke a glass and used expletives 

Staff member wearing sportswear and chewing a cocktail stick

Broken tableware

Manager hopes we will have a better experience next time

title: Champagne and Caviar
text: If you want the most romantic and fun anniversary place, you must go to The Plaza Hotel in New York for Champagne and Caviar! It's truly magical! You will have the best time if you are lucky enough to have Kenny for your bartender! He has the best personality! He absolutely made this an experience of a lifetime!

title: Best afternoon tea in New York
text:
My friend treated me to afternoon tea at the plaza for my birthday and it really was an unforgettable experience. The hotel is beautiful, and the food was amazing. But above all our water Kazi really maid the experience unforgettable. He was welcoming and could not do enough for us. You can tell he actually cares about your experience. 

Thank you Kazi.

title: Wonderful!
text: My mom and I had wonderful time at tea. The food was super fresh. I especially enjoyed trying the salmon pastrami and cute little desserts. Plus everything came out quickly and Fariz had wonderful hospitality!

title: Tea at the Plaza
text: We  recently had the pleasure of having  afternoon tea with Mr. Fariz Tello. He was wonderful with our small child as well as my grandmother and the rest of our family. Impeccable service, food and drink recommendations, and surprises for our little girl along the way! We will definitely be back as she gets older! The experience wouldn’t have been the same without him! We loved every minute of it!

title: Birthday brunch - high tea at the plaza
text:
Wonderful birthday brunch for my wife - the service was prompt and kind and the quality of the teas and food was exceptional. Our server, Fhariz (sp?) Kindly explained the menus and options to us, and took a photo of our party. We were also serenaded by a wonderful man named Kayin with the birthday song.

10/10 would recommend for a special occasion.

title: Afternoon tea
text: Our waiter, Fariz, went way above and beyond to be sure my granddaughter felt special, along with my friends who were celebrating birthdays.  I feel like we made a friend in him.   Everything we asked ( and didn’t think to ask for) for was brought to our table in a manner of moments.  The afternoon was a very special memory for all of us.  I can’t say enough about Fariz and the entire staff at the Palm Court.

title: Afternoon Tea at the Plaza
text: Attended afternoon tea after graduation ceremony. Fariz was an excellent host. He made our experience and absolute pleasure and gave us a fantastic celebration experience. He’s been at the plaza for 32 years! If you visit the plaza for afternoon tea be sure to say hello to Fariz he will take fantastic care of you and is always willing to go above and beyond to ensure that you have a pleasurable experience.

title: Perfect
text: If we could rank higher than 5/5 we would, an absolutely amazing experience. Fariz is the best and made us feel so welcome. The food is beyond delicious, the tea is beautiful and the experience is incredible!

title: High Tea at The Plaza
text: Fariz Tello was the best server at The Palm Court. He suggested amazing tea, and went the extra mile and gave us a teabag for home. Since The PalmCourt was out of the tea selection for purchase, Fariz showed us the tea maker and let us know we could purchase the tea directly. He even helped make our tea time special by formally presenting the meal. He gave us chocolates on our way out and we had a great time.

title: Tea Time!
text: Pinky’s up, it’s tea time! A fantastic one to say the least! Thank you to Kayin Lewin who was so attentive. Coming from a restaurant owner, anyone would be lucky to have him. Everything was A+. Big Ben and Oolong Lavender teas were delicious. Food was great and they happily accommodated my gf allergy. Couldn’t be more pleased.  We will be back for our next visit to NYC!

title: Drinks in the Champagne Bar at The Plaza
text: Had a wonderful experience at the Champagne Bar at The Plaza in New York City.  Stopped in for a late afternoon cocktail while my wife and I were visiting our daughter in New York.  Barman Kenny showed us a wonderful time and made us terrifically crafter cocktails.  Will make this a regular tradition every time we return to The Big Apple.

title: Yea at the Plaza
text: One of the best things I have ever done in my life! A absolute dream! My waitor Mamun was the best waitor I have ever had! He made my experience a dream with his service! He went above and beyond! You must go to the Plaza and have tea with Mamun

title: High Tea
text: A truly spectacular experience! The food was delicious, the environment luxurious, and the service provided by Fariz was phenomenal. Be sure to take time to visit the bathroom and check out the display cases. Highly recommended!

title: Russ is the best bartender I ever met.
text: Russ is the best bartender I ever met. Very personal and friendly . Love to go there every time. Just to see him and say hello.....Thanks. the best of the best. Good food too. I  would highly recommend and praise   the great  environment

title: Yea at The Plaza Hotel
text: My wife and I stopped here to start our honeymoon. Kayin Lewin helped us from start to finish and made the start of our honeymoon perfect. Food/tea was excellent. Highly recommend you visit here. Kayin was able to give us excellent service that you cannot put a price on. He was friendly, polite, and incredibly knowledgeable. Simply based on my interaction with him, as long as he’s still working there, I’ll continue to send friends and family to visit. We also had another gentleman serving us, which I forgot to get his name. His service was just as welcoming and warming. We truly felt like we were important and our experience was cared about. They even gave us a glass of champagne and a goodie box as a good gesture for our honeymoon. Afternoon tea was my wife’s one thing we had to do in NYC…I won’t lie, I wasn’t too stoked. But happy wife, happy life, right? I’ll admit, I was wrong. Guys, go with your wife. It’ll make her happy, you’ll meet the wonderful staff, and you’ll get some really good food and tea. Once again, highly recommended.

title: Amazing Tea Time at the Plaza with Fariz!
text:
My sisters, nieces, mom and myself went to have Tea Time at the Plaza Hotel at the end of April. It was a wonderful experience! Our server Fariz was remarkable! He completely made the experience for us! He was so sweet and made us feel right at home. My nieces, who are ages 3 and 5, kept saying he is SO nice. 
We are so thankful for Fariz and the rest of the team for making this such an unbelievable experience for us!

Highly recommend!

title: Mother’s Day Afternoon Tea
text: Kayin was a wonderful host, super attentive and kind. He helped make Mother’s Day tea very memorable! The pastries and sandwiches themselves were very delicious, not too indulgent, just the right amount.

title: Anniversary
text: Completely awesome service.  Very friendly, eager to take multiple wonderful photos of us which we have shared with our family.  Also gave us a thorough explanation of the unique foods we were eating.  He definitely helped make the experience very memorable.

title: Yea at the Plaza
text: Kayin was a delight - such a gracious & welcoming host. What a treat! Not only was he helpful but also very knowledgeable. An incredible New York tradition that everyone should do! Ask for Kayin if you want the best host.

title: Tea at the Plaza
text: Tea at the Plaza was amazing! The food was very yummy and the service was great. Kayin Lewin was sweet and quick to take pictures and answer any questions! He made the trip to the Plaza very enjoyable.

title: Afternoon Tea at the Plaza
text: Such an amazing afternoon at the plaza. The whole team are very attentive. Nothing is too much trouble. Kaylin Lewin was especially helpful offering to take some photographs and just lending a helpful hand thoughout.

title: Great birthday splurge
text: Fun time at the Plaza. My wife surprised me for my birthday, because she knew the Plaza was a bucket list experience for me. Had a great night eating in the suite, and the breakfast at the Palm Court being served by Kayin was a memory I will cherish.

title: Worth the hype!
text: My mom and I went to the Palm Court for high tea and had the most wonderful experience. Delicious tea and food! Kayin took great care of us and brought us extra lemon curd for our scones. Personally loved the marbled rye smoked salmon and the chai tea.

title: Everything we wanted it to be
text: Booked the champagne afternoon tea as a birthday treat and it was, as the title says, everything we wanted it to be. A beautiful room, fabulous food, attentive service that was friendly but never intrusive. Very special but not stuffy and a real sense of fun. Particularly great service from Elvis (not that one) that included a rendition of Happy Birthday for my partner  & Kayin L who took plenty of pictures for us and made us feel at home all the way. Can't recommend it enough

title: Not the class and elegance I expected
text: Perhaps we caught the Plaza on an off night. Perhaps the Plaza isn’t what it used to be. It was my first time visiting the Plaza, so I’m not sure which statement is more accurate. Drinks at the Champagne Bar was the start of a lovely date night (followed by Broadway and fine dining). The bar was packed and incredibly loud. There were screaming children. I realize dressing up for anything these days is different, but the women in joggers and baseball hats at the bar surprised me. It didn’t have the elegance I had read so many reviews about, was expecting, and looking forward to. Rather than staying, we exited and found a classy (and quieter…no screaming children) bar at a nearby hotel. It had more of the class and etiquette we had hoped to enjoy at the Plaza.

title: Tea at the Plaza
text: My mother and I decided to treat ourselves for Mother’s Day weekend! What a treat it was! The service, the atmosphere, the food, the drinks, everything was incredible! We enjoyed the “Mommy and Me” tea service and it was delectable! A great variety of finger sandwiches and deserts that were very tasty! I would recommend this to anyone!

title: High Tea at the plaza - a wonderful experience
text: My daughter brought me to the Plaza for afternoon tea as a Mother’s Day celebration. We absolutely loved it! They have the friendliest staff and I highly recommend this experience for anyone traveling to NYC - it really is a a wonderfully experience. The food and drinks are absolutely fabulous. We are going to come here any time we come to visit NYC. Big thank you to Carlos behind the bar who took great care of us and make our experience even more wonderful. And thank you to Kayin, who’s charisma and charm made our day! Thank you!

title: Great New York Experience and Hospitality
text: Came back to start early Mother’s Day celebrations. Had tea service and Sparkling Rosé, sandwiches and scones are delicious. The Plaza has always the best service the hospitality is always at its best. Particularly, Kayin Lewin was an amazing host taking our pictures from different angles, he has the energy and spirit to make you feel like home.  This is an experience that worth every penny and is a must for anyone that is a movie lover, a wine lover and of course a tea lover. Add it to your ‘must visits’ in New York City.

title: Palm Court at the Plaza Hotel
text: We had a wonderful tea with delicious food and sweets.  Kayin Lewin took great care of us. He was professional accommodating and courteous. We will definitely be back anytime we are on New York. Thank you

title: Tea at The Plaza
text:
One of the best experiences.  Highly recommend.
Fariz was attentive and service was great. Can't say enough good things about it. Can't say enought good things about it. Can't say enough good thi gs about it.

title: A bucket list must do!!
text: Fantastic service from Shalim Khan ~ whose been working there for 33 years ~  he knew the menu fully & able to explain it all to us newbies to High Tea!! The Grand Imperial Afternoon Tea was fabulous & oh so fun to celebrate my Mom for Mother’s Day!! The Cristal champagne was divine and the Jasmine Pearls Grand Cru Tea is now my favorite tea!!

title: Lovely
text: Just lovely. Really loved this place. ❤️  high tea was excellent. And Fariz Tello made our day! Nice place to have a brunch when it's rainy in New York. Even the kids loved it. And the building itself is worth a visit itself. Check it out!

title: Tea time at The Plaza!
text: Perfectly sophisticated and magical experience! I brought my mother for tea as an early Mother’s Day present. Our server, Kabir was exceptional and made our time there so memorable. The food was deliciously extravagant! I still can’t get over the beautiful little pastries and treats we got to enjoy. All of the staff we encountered were lovely, attentive, and helpful. Spending time in such a historical and iconic hotel while sipping lavender tea was the perfect way to celebrate my mom and we will never forget our first time(not our last!) at The Palm Court at The Plaza!

title: A great first time experience!
text: Our first time and Muhibul made us feel like regulars!  Who knew tea and sandwiches were sooo goood? Thanks Muhibul! The teas were very different and flavorful, the sandwiches varied and amazing, and the champagne phenomenal. We enjoyed exploring the sweets and scones as well.

title: Afternoon tea
text: This is not a review of a stay at the Plaza but of afternoon tea at the Palm Court in the hotel. There was plenty of tea, but I was disappointed in the sweets and sandwiches. I didn't particularly enjoy most of the sweets - they looked beautiful, though. The scones were pretty good. And the sandwiches were small and just so-so. I thought it was all slightly underwhelming. And there were no refills on any of the sandwiches or sweets, which I know isn't typical but I remember having refills at a high-end tea at a high-end Chicago hotel a few years ago, which was very memorable. For the price here (more than $100 per person), why not refills? Or bigger and better treats? The worst part, however, was the bathroom situation: there was a long line-up for the 2 stalls in the one ladies room available to visitors, which was already out of toilet paper when I went in and no one coming around to refill it. Not good.

title: Tea time at the Plaza
text: Fariz was our server for Tea at the Palm Court recently and I can not wait to go back! Impeccable and kind service. Aside from the elegant menu Fariz’s attention and flawless service really elevated the experience for this mom to be. Can’t wait to come back with our little one.

title: Worse experience - personally violated
text:
Long list - here goes …

(1) unknown man accessed my room as I was dressing as such I was violated and no longer felt safe.  

(2) numerous confirmations that we’d have a baby carseat for our transport. No car seat departing hotel - which was unsafe riding in a vehicle with an infant.

(3) no acknowledgment from The Palms restaurant or hotel for our daughter’s birthday despite numerous emails & calls in advance of our arrival.

(4) I have yet to receive my final invoices for our suite & adjoining room).

(5) on the last night of our 2 night stay, staff delivered complimentary desserts with a card apologizing. Not sure if our welcome treat was combined with the dessert tray.   

(6) it’s been over a week since we departed but we are extremely disappointed and I personally feel traumatized and violated by the incident involving an unknown man entering my room without a knock.

GC

title: Amazing high tea experience!!
text: Had the best time having high tea with my mother to celebrate my birthday. The staff were so attentive and polite—Kayin in particular was great! He offered to take some photos of us and he got allll the angles. We even saw a celebrity doing a photo shoot before going to the Met Gala! Such a cool and fun experience.

title: Afternoon Tea at The Plaza
text: The afternoon tea at The Plaza Hotel in NYC was absolutely AMAZING! The atmosphere is so elegant and makes you feel like royalty. Our waiter, Fariz Tello, was so gracious and made our experience even more wonderful. Would HIGHLY recommend.

title: Kayin made us smile!
text: Wonderful time at The Palm for tea.  Kayin stopped by to greet us & took some great photos.  Made our visit special!  Had the Manhattan Tea with champagne.  Awesome selection of sandwiches, scones & dessers.

title: Afternoon Tea
text: Great service and experience with Fariz! He was very attentive to every detail of our wonderful afternoon tea experience. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone wanting to enjoy The Plaza.

title: Afternoon Tea!
text: The Plaza is a must in NYC! Kayin was wonderful and we had a great time with him during our lunch ! I had a great time with my friends! The sandwiches that come with the “Manhattan Tea” are excellent!

title: Afternoon Tea at The Plaza
text: Grand fun! Make sure to meet Kayin - he's fabulous! Lovely smile and great sense of humor. We had the Manhattan tea, which was plenty for the 2 of us. The people watching is fun, too. We got a beautiful tin of macarons for my birthday.

title: Best experience at afternoon tea!
text: Kazi was incredible, best customer service we have ever received. Went to celebrate my aunts birthday and she was showered with gifts! When I go back to the Plaza for afternoon tea, I will be asking for him again!

title: Birthday Tea
text: I came to the Plaza for a birthday tea and received excellent service from a gentleman named Kayin Levin. He went above and beyond taking lovely photos of our group form various angles- then when one of our party members was gone he offered to come back and take more photos. Hats off to him!

title: A must stop in NYC!
text: A MUST to visit! Whether you make a reservation at The Palm Court for afternoon tea or just a glass of bubbles at the bar - the service & ambiance is unmatched. Ask for Fariz Tello to be your sever!!!

title: Yea at The Palm Court
text: The experience was spectacular. Fariz Tello took excellent care of our party and everyone should ask for him. The food and tea were phenomenal. The 2 children in our group also had a marvelous time. Send a postcard and enjoy the stay.

title: Best Afternoon Tea
text: Just had thee best time with friends at Palm Court. The whole experience was magical and so elegant too. The real icing on the cake was Fariz. He was so welcoming and made us feel like we were having tea at our rich uncle's home. We will definitely be back.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
Loved every moment there. Luxury hotel with great rooms, great service and amazing staff.
Spent 9 nights there with my family and had breakfast every day in the hotel's Champagne Coffee. 
The location, right on the 5th avenue and Central park is perfect.

title: Great service at the palm court!
text: We loved our trip to the palm court. Porfirio provided excellent service making sure we always had everything we needed. The food was delicious. The tea options were great.  Would definitely recommend a afternoon here!!

title: Palm Court tea
text: Afternoon tea was good, not quite a wow but the highlight for us was our server Fariz. Service was gracious and thoughtful from the black napkins to the excellent rosé. He was very attentive but not obsequious and made our afternoon a joy. Fariz was the highlight and brought a level of style and service you expect from the Plaza.

title: Signature tea at the plaza – superb.
text: Phenomenal service. The experience is excellent. The desserts were not my favorite, but I’m sure some people would love them. The tea was out of this world. The du Hammam. I have wanted to come to Tea  here for 40 years. I enjoyed every moment of it. Very elegant. My server, Fariz, was perfection. All of the wait staff was beyond excellent!

title: Amazing server
text: Beautiful after noon tea at the palm court. Fariz was incredibly amazing, he absolutely made my cousin’s birthday celebration very special. We enjoyed Our conversation with him. Thank you so much. Will be back soon ❤️

title: Afternoon tea for birthday
text: Fariz was our server and he was so friendly and wonderful. My family and I felt very welcomed from the moment we entered The Palm Court. I had a very special birthday here with a special box of macarons as a gift. I would definitely recommend if you want to feel welcomed.

title: Mrs hingley
text: Absolutely wonderful experience, wheelchair accessible and all staff were so friendly and helpful throughout. The afternoon tea is stunning, plenty there and a beautiful take home bag if you can’t finish it all. Would definitely recommend this for everyone who is visiting New York. The deco and atmosphere here is warm and comforting, come as you are no discrimination. Service was outstanding.

title: Tea at The Plaza
text: From the welcome host to our wonderful server Fariz, no one does service like The Plaza. It’s always been a dream of mine to have tea at The Palm Court and wow was I impressed. The tea was perfectly brewed and each delicious food item was exquisite. I definitely recommend tea at The Plaza.

title: Highlight of our New York trip!
text:
We had a short layover before our European vacation  and decided to on the plaza  and what a delightful treat our afternoon tea was and our host server Fariz was wonderful!!!
We certainly would recommend it to everyone. 
Looking forward to coming back for Christmas 2022!

title: A fabulous GF high tea
text: Fariz was an incredible server, took care of every detail and made sure our birthday celebration was just perfect! The gluten free high tea was so delicious, such a special treat and the ambience is unbeatable!

title: Anita’s 21st Birthday
text:
I have been dreaming of coming to the Plaza for afternoon tea with my mother for my 21st birthday since I was 16. The day did not disappoint! We had champagne, macarons, and those fantastic finger sandwiches. My mother has a gluten allergy, but the staff was very accommodating. Special thanks to Fariz Tello, he made our outing so much more special. I will remember this day for the rest of my life. 

Thank you so much to the outstanding staff at the Plaza. You made my dreams come true!

title: Afternoon tea
text: We had an absolutely wonderful afternoon tea! The service was fantastic and the food was delicious. Every part of the experience was top notch. We loved our waiter, Porfino! They even gave us a gift of beautiful Plaza chocolates.

title: The most magnificent stay in the most magnificent hotel!
text:
My husband Rodney and I travelled from Ireland to stay in this wonderfully magnificent hotel which has been on our travel wish list for a very long time! In fact, we were due to stay here on part of our honeymoon back in 2005; however, the hotel was closed for the refurbishment work and we didn’t get to stay. We then booked for Easter 2020 but had to cancel due to the Covid-19 pandemic so, third time lucky. Alaina and Raechel in Reservations were so helpful in arranging and re-arranging our bookings as well as ensuring everything was organized precisely and so, fast forward to Easter 2022…

We were efficiently checked-in by the wonderful Loai and our suite was amazing! Prior to being shown to our suite, Shweta from the International Sales team called down to The Champagne Bar to greet us. Loai and Shweta were both so lovely and welcoming. We stayed in a one-bedroom penthouse suite on the twentieth floor. The suite spanned across two floors. The first floor included a downstairs water closet with shower; cloakroom; living room (with sofa, arm chairs, desk and breakfast table); kitchenette (complete with microwave, drawer dishwasher, mini bar) and study. The study had its own sofa, TV, closets and pocket doors which would be perfect as a children’s bedroom. Upstairs was a large king bedroom with a large bathroom (separate water closet, shower, double sinks, bath) and our own separate private terrace which overlooked the courtyard. We also had spectacular views of the many skyscrapers. The attention to detail within the suite and, the whole hotel, is first class. 

Located at Fifth Avenue and south Central Park, The Plaza Hotel is so close to the shoppers’ paradise of all the luxury brands – Tiffany’s, Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Van Cleef & Arpels etc. It was super handy to nip out to the stores and return to our hotel suite to save having to carry around lots of shopping bags. Also, with fantastic Central Park being opposite the hotel, it was great to simply cross the street for a lovely walk. Other must-sees are nearby including St. Patrick’s Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, the New York Public Library and the Museum of Modern Art.

Oh, and there was our butler! Mouhsine was superb – anything we wanted, Mouhsine was more than obliging. He kept us going with lots of tea and also organized macaroons for the room. Mouhsine also left two beautiful vases of fresh flowers in the living room for us on the second day.

Judy in Housekeeping was fantastic and kept our suite immaculate. A really lovely touch was that on the second day, we returned to the suite and found that the two photos of our children which we had taken with us on our trip were now in proper photo frames on our lockers! We met Judy the next day on her rounds and she was so lovely. She couldn’t do enough to make our stay so memorable and her kindness was amazing.

We had breakfast in the Palm Court each morning except for one morning when we had in-room dining. Breakfast in the Palm Court was amazing. Proferio and his team were consistently fantastic. The Palm Court as a setting is complete splendor. In-room dining in the afternoon/evenings was always super quick – within 20 minutes from time of ordering to delivery. Rodney gave all meals 10 out of 10 marks - all were outstanding in terms of flavors and presentation which were second to none.

On the last day of our stay, we had afternoon tea in The Palm Court. Elvis and his colleagues were amazing and if you haven’t had afternoon tea in The Plaza then you haven’t had afternoon tea. It was so delicious. Every bite of food we ate during our stay was first class and my husband and I know good food. 

Overall, all the staff who we encountered at The Plaza were so polite, professional, kind and simply lovely. The hotel is absolutely magnificent and we had the most amazing stay. We look forward to returning with our children for our next stay during Christmas 2022.

What makes The Plaza magnificent, outstanding and the best is not just the iconic hotel, the heritage, the location or the food perfection, it is the staff. Whilst the staff training and the aim for perfection comes through, it is more than that. It is the genuine kindness that the staff have which makes you feel at home and they consistently do their very best for guests. A stay at The Plaza will make memories that will last a life time.

Lynda Hegarty-McDermott

title: Weekend at the plaza
text: If you want to enjoy true luxury and stay in central park the plaza has it all. My wife and I were extremely impressed by the staffs attention to detail. When I picked up phone to order ice or room service the staff was on it. We have already booked trip for May 2023 and are staying longer on our next visit.

title: Most luxurious hotel experience ever
text: I had one extra night in NYC after my friend left town and decided to treat myself to a night at the Plaza (“for how much a night?!” my mother’s voice echoed in my head) . Best decision I’ve ever made. From the faint scent of gardenia throughout the entire hotel, to the attentive and impeccable service at every corner, to the large and luxurious rooms—I don’t think I could ever stay anywhere else again when I’m in the city. The history and grandeur are unbeatable, and definitely treat yourself to a spa experience there if you have the time! This hotel is worth every penny.

title: perfect as always
text:
Third time back at the plaza and we were not disappointed. Still love the hotel, and most of all the staff. They couldn't be more welcoming! Our son was more that happy about the massive chocolate Easter egg he received :) 

Although I do understand why they closed down the food hall, it really is a shame, it has always been convenient and was truly missed this time around!

title: Very Nice Stay
text: I liked the room very much: tall ceilings, large (luxurious) bathroom, great closets! The furniture is very grande dame hotel - I liked it - one chair had fringe hanging off of it. The lobby is a terrible tourist trap - lots of people come into the lobby to take pictures - security needs to keep a very close watch on people just coming in for the photo op. All interactions with staff were very good - staff is welcoming and professional. Location is great: 59th Street and Fifth Avenue - one of the great iconic addresses of New York.

title: Simply Elegant and Classy
text: We stayed here on April 14, 2022 for our daughter's 13th birthday. Wow, the Plaza is simply amazing. Staff was so nice and check-in was smooth. Got there around Noon and our room was ready. Got to our room and had a nice birthday gift waiting for our daughter- so thoughtful! The butler service was perfect and loved eating in the Champagne room! The Plaza is simply amazing! I would recommend staying here- so close to Central Park as we took a few nice long walks. The rooms are beautiful with robes, slippers, everything you need! We will definitely stay here again- felt like royalty staying here! Don't get me started on the awesome afternoon tea- OMG! That was terrific!

title: Who sets the room rates at this tourist trap? Insanely overpriced.
text: $1,600 a night for a two queen bedded room? Seriously?. The Plaza is all flash but no substance anymore, service is lacking and rooms could use a refresh. Rates are INSANE, the Peninsula and Park Hyatt offer better service and are less money.

title: hotel is too old and too few amenities for the absurd prices
text: terrible experience and I was there for 2 weeks. absurd prices for a very old hotel that has no amenities nor any staff to help. no coffee machine nor any wifi plugs in a suite that was suppose to include a butler (who i never saw).  the staff was either not trained or just plain curt.

title: Great hotel terrible restaurants
text:
The hotel is Nice. The water pressure in the rooms is great. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are great.

There is one glaring problem for a five star that the service is terrible in the restaurants. Absolutely Some of the worst. Breakfast was a disaster.

title: outdated TV, old remotes.  overly crowded, nothing to order food after 10pm.
text: I stayed here with the expectation of first class experience.  Hotel is nice because of its look, but elevator is tiny and spooky.  The TV in the room was outdated.  The hotel does not have anythign to eat after 10pm.  I ordered room service, and there was debris in the glass.  Not worth the money.

title: A fabulous place to stay.
text:
This hotel has been on my bucket list for many years and it did not disappoint. From meeting Tony who took our suitcases and was so helpful to all the other friendly and attentive staff who made the stay special. I’d emailed ahead to let them know we were celebrating 2 special birthdays. On arrival to our room we were greeted with champagne, fruit and a little birthday cake. Special touches that make a difference. We had the kind deluxe room and this was really spacious and elegant.  The burger and fries we ate in the palm court that evening were really nice. The fries were especially tasty.  We had breakfast each morning  in The Palm Court. I was a little disappointed with the breakfasts. The best one I had by far was the Shakshuka. Our waiter Portafina was so attentive and happy. The consistency with what was billed for breakfast wasn’t great. Some days juice was free and so were coffee refills then other days not. I did mention this at the time and they rectified a couple of bills.  
The hotel was a really elegant place and I’m glad I’ve had the chance to stay here. Great location. Lots of happy memories made.

title: Plaza not what it used to be :(
text:
The Plaza was a favorite. Last stayed in 2017, then most recently in 2021. 
The good: the beds and large bathroom. The wonderful smell throughout hotel. 
The bad: check in took 20 mins. Staff was talking in an area away from the desk and finally the bellman became frustrated and told them to help guests. 
The food: subpar. Nothing special. This includes the tea service now. 
Valet: subpar. Not helpful, tipping does not change this. 
View: obstructed even in expensive rooms. 
Requests: not honored, no special anything anymore. 

Stay at the Mark, Mandarin or even the Baccarat.

title: Classic Perfection
text: When in NYC, there is no where else to stay.  Its the best.   The Plaza Hotel provides an elegant experience and incomparable service.  The location across from Central Park and close to the best shopping gives so much to see and do.  And you won't find better water pressure in a hotel anywhere.

title: A wonderful, luxurious, classic NY stay!
text:
We were greeted with smiles and had a fantastic stay throughout. The Plaza team kindly offered us a free upgrade as it was my fiancé’s 30th birthday. They also kindly gave us a welcome bottle of champagne and a dessert to celebrate the special occasion.  The room was exceptional with plenty of amenities (hairdryer, fresh bottled water every day, Guerlain toiletries, etc). The bed was very comfortable, a perfect balance between firm and soft, plenty of pillows. Room heating was working well. The bathroom was spacious and had a stand-alone shower, separate bathtub and two sinks. Room service was amazing, fast and food/drink was still hot on arrival. Would recommend the buffalo wings for a late night snack! 

The only thing I would say is that when we left the hotel for the airport, the doorman kindly got us a taxi and we said we were find carrying our suitcases down. When we sat in the taxi, he stared at us and shook his head as if in disgust that we didn’t let him carry out suitcases. Evidently he was annoyed that he couldn’t get a chance for another tip.

Despite that, it was a wonderful stay and would recommend The Plaza to anyone. Thank you for a memorable holiday! We can’t wait to visit again.

title: Lives up to the hype!
text:
I just left the Plaza after a wonderful weekend celebrating my daughter’s 11th birthday.  The Plaza had been on my bucket list for years and I was worried that it wouldn’t live up to the hype.  I can safely say that it met all my expectations!  
The service is what sets it apart from other hotels.  The doormen, the bellman, the concierge, the staff in the champagne bar and Palm Court, etc etc. 
- The rooms are beautiful in a luxurious historic manner.  
- I would highly recommend the afternoon tea.  You need a reservation and it is absolutely worth it.  
- the concierge will make sure you are taken care of.  From car service to restaurant reservations and everything in between.  For example, if you have been wanting to go to Ellen’s, but didn’t want to stand in line, the Concierge will fast track you to the front of the line.

Thank you to everyone at the Plaza who made my daughter’s dreams come true.
